Review_body: A very good movie, and follow up to T2, the action was well spread out, and it was not over killed by dialog as in the matrix reloaded. The ending was completely unexpected, and opened the door to T4. Overall 4 out 5 rating for a great third installment to the terminator series.

Review title: A script that James Cameron would have shot, but not with film
Review_body: All I can say is that I was disappointed with this film. I loved the first Terminator, a wonderful apocalyptic film with an excellent tight script, which built tension with dark sets and dark characters, and was shot with a small budget. I really enjoyed the second film, a wonderful apocalyptic action-packed film shot on a huge budget (once again a tight script). I hated the third film because it was and action-packed film but not much else...besides the big budget of course. Eventually the car chases just become more of "been there, done that."How many times can you watch cyborgs throw one another into a wall (just like in the second film)?How many times can you watch the a big rig chasing our heroes down the street (just like the first and second)?The only difference with this film over the others is that in this one the terminators attack one another with every form of plumbing fixture known to man.During a pivotal scene, John Connor, our hero, threatens to shoot himself in the head unless the Arnold terminator does what John asks. I was praying that John would have pulled the trigger just so that I would be able to leave the theater that much sooner.Save yourself the money you would waste on this one and go rent the first two in this series. It will afford a better evening and it will you save you the trouble of driving to the movie theater.
Best cgi best cast great acting everything's is good in this film

Review title: A good, solid, film; however, the lack of Cameron diminishes it's overall effect.
Review_body: The original "Terminator" was an amazing film for 1984, the action was unprecedented, the visuals phenomenal, and the human drama a welcome surprise. In 1991 James Cameron shocked audiences by making T2 better than the original in almost every area; creating one of the greatest films of all time. T3: Rise Of The Machines is a really good film; however, the lack of Cameron's directing is felt throughout the entire film, greatly diminishing its overall effect. For instance, the acting sequences in this one are more confusing than the one's in T2; gone are the days of the T-1000(in a Semi) chasing the young John Conner(on a dirt-bike) while Arnold(on a Harley) pursues both of them. Cameron has a way of making audiences completely understand an action sequence, Jonathan Mostow still has a lot to learn.As T3 begins we don't get any of the classic Terminator music that was present in the last 2 films, instead we get eary music which is very quickly followed by the film's title, "Terminator 3: Rise Of The Machines;" which of course is then followed by Arnold's full name, reminding all of us that while James Cameron and Linda Hamilton may be missing, we all came to see Arnold kick some ass. The film has a hard time, at first, making us feel pity or any other form of compassion for, the older and more mature, John Conner. Thankfully by the time John explains to us how his mother, Sarah Conner, died of cancer we've actually grown to like John. Soon after the introduction of John, we meet the new terminator: a Terminatrix, played farely well by newcomer Kristinna Lokken. The TX is an improvement over the T-1000, she can form weapons with her liqued metal skin and she can also infiltrate and control other machines; however, despite all of her advancements she doesn't quite make us shuddder in fear like the original T-101 or T-1000. After all of the new characters have been introduced the movie descends into one action scene after another, while all are good, we still feel like we're covering old ground. Thankfully, just when you think the new Terminator is a little soft, she graphically impales a detective with her arm and then procedes to drive the car from the back seat: With Her "ARM" still sticking through his chest! Yes, it was a very disturbing scene. Despite all of the new action sequences, I really enjoyed listening the John Conner's little lectures about the future, fate, machines and his own destiny. They didn't feel "canned" in the least, I was very impressed.By the end of T3, I realised two very important things: (1) I actually care about what happens to John Conner and (2) The storyline of T2 has become "almost" completely obsolete; I may be the only one who feels this way, but the 3rd film in a trilogy is supposed to build upon the plot in the "middle" movie, not refute it. So there you have it, T3 is a new kind of Terminator movie; it doesn't improve upon the second film, but it presents a new face that's different enough to make the film very entertaining.

Review title: The franchise just got a lot better!
Review_body: I'll try not to sound like a Warner Brothers Exec. with my comments on this movie, but it's going to be difficult I'm afraid.Let me just get it out of my system: T3 - Rise of the machines is one of the best (if not the best) Action/sci-fi movies I have ever seen!!! Now there I said it...It's hard though, to judge a movie these days as you become older and older cause the first time impressions will never become the same as when you saw like The Terminator as a 10 year old boy back in 1984. Still from time to time a movie comes along that simply grabs you by the ba...(well they are fragile) within 10 minutes and don't let go till you've tormented your wallet with half a dusin repeat viewings, which will be the case for me with this movie, once it's officially released. The last time I experienced this was in ´98 when The Matrix was out (something that sadly wasn't repeated with "Reloaded").Terminator 3 is simply AMAZING IMO. It is fast paced, in your face high definition action wrapped around a tight storyline with some very fulfilling revelations, but as an action piece, this baby comes close to being orgasmic!Now though I may sound like it, I'm no Arnold/Terminator fanboy, but I AM an actionjunkie, a true sucker for clever action epics.This movie took me by total surprise and that may be the explanation as to why I seem so positive. I really didn't expect much from this movie judging by the trailers. Not even the last trailer was particular good IMO, but let me tell you this is one of the rare times when a trailer truly didn't reveal anything from the movie. T3 is SOO MUCH bigger than what the trailer makes it appear.I loved T2, it's one of my fav sci-fi movies, but T3 is just better! At NO point does this movie drag and though it does rehash most of the scenes from T2 it makes sure to nudge these scenes up like 50-100%, but at the same time it introduces a lot of new and fresh jaw-droppers. This movie will leave scars on the furniture of the theaters from all the nails that will dig into the seats.To you skeptics out there, and I now there are plenty, FORGET YOUR WORRIES and go see this thing, cause NO ONE can claim to NOT be entertained by T3.Isn't there anything negative? Well there was a corny cameo from T2 that I didn't like and I was certain I would hear the famous Brad Fiedel theme playing to the credits which it didn't (we got some remixed version in the end though). Other than that it was a perfect movie!5/5

T3 had it's moments. Action wise it was very good, as for the story well in my opinion it was average. The film misses cameron, had he been a part of it i think it would have been a classic like the previous two. Arnie was boring in this film, didn't have the same spark as in T2, i guess though in this film he is a different cyborg. But either way arnie is one of my fav actors. An average film, good action but could have done much better with the story.

Review title: Terminator 3 appeals to long time fans and newcomers as well, this was a great movie.
Review_body: Now im not going to give any of the movie away, because it will not be nearly as good if i do. T3 definitly takes a step up from T2 and T1 in the special effects department. Some of the special effects were absolutely breathtaking. The TX (Lokken)was brilliant as she acted so much like a machine i almost thought that she was! she has very few lines so for most of the movie, she uses facial expressions. She is also very...evil. within the first 20 minutes of the movie she kills quite a few people. Arnold comes back strong as the somewhat primitive Terminator Model-101. Again, like T2 he is greatly at the disadvantage. I think Arnold played the terminator better in T3 then he did in any of the other ones. He seemed a lot more like a machine.As for Nick Stahl playing John Connor, when i first heard that he was replacing Edward Furlong i was really angry. Furlong was the original John Connor, not to mention hes a great actor. He would have been perfect to play Connor again. But i was pleasantly suprised, Nick Stahl played the part great, and you got the feel that he was very nervous, and unstable about judgement day and his destiny from the first moment you saw him. Kathryn Brewster(Claire Danes)is Connors supporting character and Danes does a much better job then i thought she was going to do. All in All, the acting was very well done.The plot had some holes in it but not too bad. I think that they could have cleared a few things up. However, the ending stole the entire movie. I was completely stunned at the end, and it was very unpredictable....i had NO clue it was even coming.All in All, definitly worth the $9.00, maybe another $9.00 if i want to go again.....i urge everyone to go see this movie, it was great8.5/10

When I watched Terminator 3 I knew it would never be as good as Terminator 2: Judgement day. But the producers knew that too so they added much more comedy, which was awesome! When the terminator first came and picked up those star shaped shades I must say that I laughed my ass of :) That said, the fighting and totally destroying was fun, but some part of me kinda wished that Terminator ended after the second movie.But as a sum up: Awesome movie, but watch Terminator 2 if you haven't seen it yet!!That's all I have to say about this movie.

What a waste of time.This franchise is soooo depleted,the great cyborg is being embarrassed,they should really have stopped at "2" & that's pushing it.They recycled a lot of stuff from the first 2.To think this waste outdid "The Hulk".Let me say that a lot of movies have some sort of computer graphics so the argument that you can't sit through something that's not real just doesn't fly. They hyped it to milk it(T3).The acting is terrible,T2 was borderline but this is awful how anyone could put this movie above the first(T1) is insane.That was a movie.Poor Arnold should quit while he's ahead,this is just 1 in many recent bad movies for "the oak". See it for curiosity but your not missing anything.

Review title: Terminator is back, but not better than the first sequels.
Review_body: I just returned back from the cinema, where I watched the third sequel of the Terminator. Overall, it was not bad, and it was not too good either. Schwarzenegger was ok, the female terminator wasn't bad either, but the thought of her driving the police vehicle remotely doesn't fit right (anyway, she's sexy :-))... The plot is straight, nothing difficult to understand, and I think that the main point is that the dudgment day was inevitable, it was something that could only be postponed for some time... I think that all Terminator and the Matrix movies are on the same track and we must all think about how possible is a world that both these movies show. I just hope there won't be any Terminator 4, to continue from where the third sequel stopped...

Review title: A surprisingly good follow-up to one of the best action movies of all time.
Review_body: I, like many other people, went into see terminator 3 with a grim face. After all, how could any movie top terminator 2?  Especially with everything that was going against this movie being good.  After watching it though, I am a convert.  Terminator 3 is both an excellent movie experience and a thrilling follow-up to T2.  The only thing that dampened the movie for me were the sheer number of people who sat their hating on the movie. Going to see T3 with loads of amateur "movie critics" is a bad idea.  As is going to see T3 with the impression that its going to be anything more than a thrilling action romp through the present day.  In my book T3 succeeds to do everything it set out to and then some.  I definitely rank it a 10/10

Review title: Action packed and breathtaking, as good as the previous Terminator films
Review_body: I had heard reports of this film as being rubbish, but in my opinion it was fantastic, every bit as good as the previous 2 films, it tells the story of what led up to judgment day and what caused the uprising of the machines, right from the beginning the action starts and never lets up till the end, I would go and see this film if I was you and make your own judgment,I think you will not be disappointed, I give it 9 out of ten.

Review title: Not as good as the 1st 2, but still a fun movie
Review_body: Action and effects were top notch.  Typical Arnold, looking good at 50+. Lacked a good story, too many new characters.Should be interesting if they go for a 4th. How much more invinceable can they make a terminator?

Review title: most disappointing film in the history of cinema...
Review_body: ...or at least in my moviegoing history.  I absolutely love the first two terminator films, but this one is just absolute BS.  It starts off well and goes downhill from there.  Whoever gave this piece of crap good reviews must've been from the studio, probably trying to push this $170,000,000 waste of celluloid.  This film should've been, and with the right talent could've been, The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly of the series.  Instead it is the Rocky 5 of the series.  Jonathan Mostow should not be allowed to make films for at least 5 years or until he 1)  SEES the first two terminator films before making any other sequels and 2) Grows up.  The die-hard fans of the terminator series are better off pretending this movie doesn't exist.

A worthy follow up to the series.  Great ending.   No spoilers from me.Liked.   The action sequences.  Claire Danes and Nick Stahl.  Arnold's one liners were funny but he is not as good in this as T2 which he was more complex(if a terminator can be so)Dislike.   Thought it needed to be a little longer.  Not enough back story to explain why this was going on again.Overall grade B+

I recently watch T3. And I didn't know what to expect from this movie or anything! I believe that it isn't BETTER than T2 but just as good as - BUT TOO SHORT. I think TX was brilliant and the new Terminator was good (darker than the last Terminator etc.) John Conner was ok I suppose yet disappointing not to see Edward reprise his role.The ending, I must say was quiet sad in a dramatic way, considering the EFFORT they put in to save the world was pointless ONLY to realise that they couldn't save anyone...-- BUT!!!!!Now that he knows of these events. I'm sure he can send someone back to prevent SKYNET EVER going online - That would be his mission and he would surely save everyone. Its OPEN for a fourth installment and I must say that I loved TX - Kristanna was AMAZING and SEXY! The terminatrix was sexy. Not often you meet a girl who can make her breats bigger.The Special FX was great. I wasn't sure if the future sequence were all models of CGI - They were good but I didn't like Nicholas playing older John in the future...I like the fact that the Terminator that killed future John protects the past John (that's funny) - It has its humurous moments. The ending IS FANTASTIC from the last 2.Don't expect it to be better than T2. Just sit and enjoy it all - A fantastic sci-fi film. Maybe a classic...dunno. Be entertained - I think most original films have past now. At least it isnt falling like my favourite ALIENS franchise. That needs to be saved.Fatastic. But my favourite is the ending and the TX.9/10 JUST SIT BACK and enjoy it.

Review title: Excellent evolution of the Terminator series
Review_body: It is a setup movie, but still stands alone as a great film. Watch for hints at another movie. The TX is ok, but Arnold is still awesome. We finally get to see Skynet!

I think it's Anie's great return, as much as unbelievable Mostow's success. Funny, pure entertainment. All that jokes, addressed to first and second flicks lovers (and some other Carolco-films) are so kind, that's impossible to be angry about it. In some places it's like video-game, times it's looks like original "Planet of the Apes", but it's good way to start 'T4'. Two thumbs up!

Review title: Terminator 3 - the machines do rise, but the movie lets down
Review_body: Responsible for James Cameron's career boost, back in 1984, was the dark action-meets-horror "The Terminator". More than another thriller, this was a mark on the history of cinema, not only for its special effects and action sequences, but for its innovator story and plot. The idea of a terminator that came back from the future to murder the mother of a boy who would become the leader of human resistance in a few decades caught everyone attention. Seven years later, James Cameron did what most directors are unable to: the sequel to "The Terminator", named "Terminator 2: The Judgement Day", surpassed the first film. With the intelligent twist of turning the first film's villain into the second one's hero, along with the introduction of the teenager John Connor and the ultimate villain T-1000, drove this film to the top, making it one of the best action / science-fiction pictures of all times.Because of all of this mystic surrounding the Terminator series, I was ecstatic with the announcement of the release of a sequel to the series, "Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines". Eventually, my expectations lowered a little when I knew James Cameron wouldn't be involved in it, although John D. Brancato and Michael Ferris (responsible for David Fincher's underrated "The Game") and Jonathan Mostow would be directing it.Ten years after Terminator 2, Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton) died of leukemia and John Connor (Edward Fulrong / Nick Stahl) became a recluse, always isolated from society. This introduces the new chapter in the Terminator series. This time, the T-850 Cyberdyne Systems Model 101 (Arnold Schwarzenegger) travels back in time to protect not only John Connor, but also a woman whose name is Katherine Brewster (Claire Danes) from another enemy: the terminatrix T-X (Kristanna Loken). But who was this Brewster character and why would the T-850 want to protect her? The answer is simple: she was going to marry John Connor and have children with him. Together, they would lead the human resistance against the machines in a not-so-distant future.Unfortunantely, it's when the existence of the terminators is justified by the authors that the plot reaches mediocrity. The excuse found for the return of the terminators is no other than fatality, the inevitability of destiny. Besides bringing up a lot of philosophical issues, this «plot twist» makes us think that all the efforts of Sarah, John and the T-800 to destroy the Cyberdyne building were completely and utterly useless. And it also makes "destiny" a fact and not an open discussion (like the existence of God, for that matter): Terminators were meant to exist and there's nothing anyone or anything can do to stop it, it's just fate. A poor excuse, in my opinion.The key-character, the T-850 (and not the T-800 as in the previous two films) is also a little disappointing. Why? After becoming a complex and almost touching character in Terminator 2, with a great chemistry between him and John Connor, the Terminator is little more than a machine and there's not the least sign of a relation between him John. This fits the plot created for this film, but it takes out something that was fundamental for the success of "Judgement Day". The only point where the authors tried to add a little humanity to the machine was when he had to face the duel between what he was programmed to do and what he «should» to: the results was terrible. At the same time, it's undeniable that Schwarzenegger's performance did put a lot of charisma into the character and it was very good to see him playing the Terminator once more. It's very hard to believe that Arnold is in his 50's, due to his great physical shape. On the other hand, the terminatrix T-X causes very little impact, despite her great attributes as a killing machine (the arms that become lethal weapons, the ability to connect to the internet and doing DNA exams in the blink of an eye, etc). It's impossible not to compare Loken's T-X to Richard Patrick's T-1000 and the second one is a clear winner. The T-1000 was a much more menacing character than the T-X and this is probably not just because of the actors, but because of the atmosphere of this film: it seems to be shot in daylight all the time, meaning that it does not have that dark side that were obvious in the other two films and were part of their greatness - the two first Terminators were thrillers and this is absolutely just an action movie.Nevertheless, despite the poor story and plot schemes, Mostow tries to draw the attentions off the plot and on the spectacular action sequences. And this is where the film's strength resides, even though the action reaches its climax early in the film. In conclusion, the third film of the Terminator saga is a close cousin to Terminator 2, since exploits the same theme of the good terminator who travels back in time to protect John Connor (and, this time, Kate Brewster) and the bad terminator who tries to do the opposite. Unfortunately, I have to admit that this was a disappointment, mostly because of its weak story and plot, but also because of the film's atmosphere (not dark at all and doesn't make you sit on the edge of your seat like the first two films did) and the lack of charisma of both John Connor (not because of Stahl's acting, but because of what Connor grows up to be; nevertheless, I would definitely like to see Edward Fulrong playing John Connor once more - after all, it was his character) and T-X. In my opinion, the emotional appeal of the terminator series along with the action sequences rescue the movie from complete failure.

Review title: "This commercial fluff was nothing but a money-maker to bridge Cameron's work with the hanging Terminator 4."
Review_body: If you're looking for mindless, repetitive, and hardly groundbreaking CG action sequences, T3 should give you underwhelming entertainment, and leave you with absolutely nothing, except how the script was approved, to reflect upon. Cameron would be rolling over in his grave (if he were dead) at this piece of marketing garbage. The previous movies' ability to stand on their own, and Judgment Day's excellent departures from the original to make a fresh experience. This commercial fluff was nothing but a money-maker to bridge Cameron's work with the hanging Terminator 4. Not to mention interesting and suspenseful storylines, character's that are a little thicker than cardboard cutouts, and flat out BRILLIANT action sequences, even without the capabilities of today's computer animation.The reversal's presented in the earlier films (Arnold, the traditional hero, becoming the relentless killing machine in the former, and then turning the tables to become an always-there dependable father figure) were not here. And while you can basically predict the ending's of Cameron's films, you don't see (SPOILERS) Reese or the Terminator's death at the end of each picture. The hack's responsible for this mess could have at least thought about throwing us a curve _somewhere_.As far as I'm concerned, this is nothing but an expensive and quality piece of mediocre "fan fiction," not part of the actual Terminator continuity. They stopped Judgment Day in movie two, this is just a side story.Remember: Just because Peter Jackson and the Wachowskis did it, doesn't mean you can.

this is the best terminator! tons of action, chase scenes and the T-X rules!!! I liked her better than Arnie!! The story is incredible and picks up where T2 left off. The special effects are so amazing that if you took all the action from terminator 1 and 2 it wouldn't even add up the amount in T3  go see it!

Review title: Don't know why people don't like it
Review_body: I've read some other reviews of T3 (not necessarily here on IMDB) that are not favorable at all. I just don't understand this at all. Being a fan of the original Terminator and T2 I found the third installment appropriate and extremely entertaining. Every movie has it's downspots and this one is no different but on the whole, T3 was a great movie. The plot was good and consistent throughout, the storyline flowed nicely, the action was amazing and the intensity increased as we got deeper and deeper into the environment. Even my wife, who is not particularly a fan of the Terminator films, enjoyed this one. The characters were well developed and, contrary to some reviews, the acting was quite good. There was a story to follow and it keeps you guessing. There are some obvious conclusions that can be made but for every one of those there's also a surprise. The casting was a concern for me until I saw the film and when I left the theatre I was convinced that they made some smart decisions in their actor choices.I would definately recommend T3 to anyone. People who have seen the original and T2 and anyone who has no clue what Terminator is all about. (Although I'm not sure there are many people like that out there) Definately worth the price of admission... more than once!

When my Dad suggested we see T3: ROTM, I had mixed feelings. I was divided between "Great, ANOTHER sequel." and "Maybe I should give it a chance." I'm glad I gave it a chance. The Terminator's self-contained humor, was great. Arnie's ability to make fun of himself is always a good thing, as most actors are unwilling, or unable to do this. I could cite a few scenes, but I won't because of some people, like myself, who hate spoilers. I thought the action scenes were good, and as morbid as this may sound, the execution scenes. The explaination of the formation of Skynet was good as well. Acting was excellent.  8/10

Review title: Biggest disappointment since Batman Forever (many spoilers)
Review_body: I went to see this film not expecting much and yet this film still managed to deliver even less that that.  This was by far the biggest let down since Warners let Schumacher loose on the Batman franchise.Firstly, when did the Terminator films become comedies.  True there were a few jokes in T2, but this was criminal.  From Arnie donning the Elton specs to "I'm back" I was cringing throughout this hell.Next, I know it's impossible to watch a film about time travel without noticing flaws, but this film was beyond the pale such as the fact that Cyberdyne has been destroyed yet the Terminators still resemble Arnie and have the Cyberdyne serial no's.  Plus there were all the classic story flaws such as the TX being a vast improvement on the t-1000.  OK, I might be wrong but she seemed to take a beating, from her weapon malfunctioning to being crushed by a helicopter (the T-1000 walked away unscathed from a helicopter crash in T2).I don't mind a few plot points being delicately nudged into a film, but this was shocking.  Where did Arnie's explosive cells come from.  Surely this would have been a hazard when he dropped into the lava at the end of T2. My favourite by far, though, was Clare Danes shouting, "it's my father's plane, I trained in it".  Phew what a relief, if she hadn't they never would have made it to the thrilling finale.All in all this was a shocker, from the stilted screenplay to the shocking filming (no need for slow-mo every scene Mostow).  I was expecting an average film and a bad Terminator film but what I got was a terrible film and an insult to James Cameron.

I'll make this short. Very short.T1 - only got one thing to say: goooooooooooooooooooddammmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmn! T2 - Even better than T1 - story line kept - not many f... ups here T3 - What can I say ?? This is rubbish. I don't consider this to be the closure, but more a standout blockbuster movie. You don't even have to have watched the others to get it.So dear film companies.. CEO's ; Dear Board.. do it again, but get James on it this time, will you ?Ah well.. there's some time I'll never get back.

Review title: A terminator rated PG13...??? Are you kidding me?
Review_body: In my opinion, and in actual fact the second terminator was the best of the 3. It consisted everything a movie that is called "The Terminator" should consist of. It was incredible intense, hardcore, and gripping the entire movie and I loved it. It was actually rated 'R' meaning that there is blood and intensity in the move. The special effects were fantastic. One thing that really caught my attention in terms of intensity was when Sarah Connor broke out of her room and threatened the man with a needle containing oil/poisoin which was already inserted into the mans neck, waiting to be injected. The blood and violence was increbly gripping as well. Not to mention the great acting from all who played in the movie, not to mention John Connor! The things he taught the terminator to help him act like a normal human being was funny and interesting.Terminator 3 was a disappointment in my oppionion. First of all a terminator movie Rated PG13...? Doesn't make sense, and the blood, violence and overall intensity were poor and the acting wasn't too great either.

Review title: Better action than Matrix, but loss of T story...
Review_body: A few have already said this, but I'll say it again anyway... It would have been  better with James Cameron.  The acting was not up to par, and the overall aura  of the film lacked from the feel of T1 & T2. I'll say now that I did like it very much, but not nearly as much as the first two. There are some things that just don't make sense, but there were those in the  first 2 as well.  Whenever you deal with time travel you are going to have some  holes in the plot.  I wasn't bothered by "when or why" the Terminators were sent  back.  I was bothered, however, by John Conner talking to Arnold and  seemingly unaware that it was not the same Arnold from T2.  I mean, doesn't he  remember the Arnold from T2 was destroyed? Conner was there and saw him die, I would have thought it'd make an impact. The new Conner just seems dumb.  This brings me to say that Stahl is no Furlong--maybe for the better in  real life, but not in the movie. The action scenes were indeed amazing.  I saw Matrix 2 last week, and unfortunately had to sit through near 20 minutes of men jumping all over cars  and trucks on the freeway.  The chase scene in T3 is short and sweet and originally well done. There is some humor in the film, which is nice. The acting, as I said earlier,  could have been better--especially when compared to the first two with Linda Hamilton.  It was a shame she wasn't in this one.  I assume they just couldn't get  her to do it. The female terminator was okay.  And I have no problem with Claire Danes, aside from the fact that the more new people in the film, the less like "Terminator" it feels. I won't spoil anything here, but if you've seen the movie you'll know what I mean:   There is certainly space for a T4, and it certainly could be great--but only if  Cameron have more say in this film.  Otherwise, it should be under a different  name. I'll sum it up by saying that T3 is a great action flick, but it lacks the sci-fi feel of  like the other 2 (especially the first, did).  However, it would have been nice to  end the series at T2, or get Cameron and the original cast to make a movie more similar to the first two.  It's turning more into a ridiculous action film--don't  get me wrong, good action--but lacking story...

T3 is like most other third entries into trilogies: it has run out of steam. The idea of a futuristic, omnipotent robot being sent back into time to eradicate the head of a stubborn resistance to a future apocalypse was novel in 1984 and was mastered in 1991.  But now it is getting old, just like Arnie.The following is a step by step analysis of why T2 just didn't work.SPECIAL EFFECTS:  The notion that after a 12 year impeovement in technology and 70 million dollar increase in budget will ensure superior special effects is a given.  T3 has better special effects than T2.  But that is the only significant category that it scores a win.VILLAIN:  This was the biggest mistake made by the developers of this film. The TX was not nearly as imposing or fearsome as either of her predecessors. I just don't have the same fear of a woman that I would a man.  Secondly, why would Skynet go back to an exoskeleton robot?!  Robert Patrick's liquid metal was an idea that should have been expanded in this movie, not scrapped.  They should have gone with Vin Diesal, a man who can hold his own with Arnie.JOHN CONNOR:  Although Stahl was adequate as Furlong's replacement, he didn't have the same edge.PLOT:  There were way too many holes in this plot.  So many things were left either unexplained or were not elaborated on.  For example, how could Skynet have been created after they destroyed its roots in T2?  Granted, the end twist was clever, and the last 30 minutes were definetely a return to T2 form, but it just didn't feel like a Terminator movie, and too many questions were left unanswered.  Interestingly, hints were given for a T4, and the ending left that door wide open and swinging.MUSIC:  Music plays a vital role in the suspense of a movie.  So many times in T3, I was wishing for the T2 theme to start playing.  It really would have added to the adrenaline rush that I felt so many times in T2.In conclusion, T3 seemed like a hastily prepared entry into such an intricately developed franchise.  While T2 is the greatest action movie of alltime, T3 is an adequate sequel, highly entertaining (in part because of the humorous side to it), but nothing more.  It sits nicely alongside the first two, and is by no means a Jaws 3, but doesn't have the chemistry that either of the first two had.  Mostow is not Cameron, Loken is not Patrick, Stahl is not Furlong, and even though Arnie was still Arnie, T3 is not T2.

Review title: ONE OF THE BEST MOVIES OF THE YEAR!!!!!!!!!!!(No Spoilers)
Review_body: I am not joking when I say this movie is the best of the year. I saw it opening day and I will never forget it. It could be one of the best in the series, and I am one of the die hard fans for the terminator series. It is Worthy of 1st or 2nd. The action is incredible. It was some of the best special effects ever. It looked as real as it could get. Even though Cameron was not the director, it would not have made a difference. An ending to die for is what left me with my jaw Dropped. Go see it now. And if you have seen it see it again, as I know I will. You Will Not be disappointed.

Review title: Won't win any Oscars, but entertaining nonetheless
Review_body: Terminator 3 is solid, uninspiring action fare, made highly watchable by it's sense of humour and refusal to take itself seriously. Quite an impressive feat, considering the film's subject matter (the world effectively destroying itself in a frenzy of nuclear missiles!)Jonathan Mostow directs without any pretentiousness, and has, at the very least, created one of the most grandiose and exciting car chases in recent memory. The effects are tremendous, and Arnold is on top form returning to his best-loved character. Some of his one-liners fail to hit the spot, but on the most part they succeed in entertaining, and the way he finds his trademark leather jacket is an unexpected treat.Nick Stahl and Claire Danes are fine in their roles, though I was somewhat underwhelmed overall. Considering the powerhouse performances of the likes of Linda Hamilton in the first two movies, that isn't too surprising.Popcorn fare of a very high quality, Terminator 3 is a weak film when judged as part of the Terminator canon, but in it's own way a real cinematic treat for a Friday evening.

Review title: Worth Seeing - Could have been better.
Review_body: I'll try my best to keep this spoiler free:THE GOOD: The two terminators - Arnold knows exactly how to play this character. He manages to make Terminator likeable, even amusing. (Why not? Everyone knows ahead of time that he's a hero.) Still, he never lets us forget that he's a super-badass killing machine. Pretty good trick for a guy in his mid 50s :)Kristanna Loken, while not quite as menacing as Robert Patrick was in T2 (Who is?), nevertheless does a fine job. She is extremely sexy, and yet, I never took her lightly. Also, I enjoyed those little bits of emotion that the director allows her show. I've been waiting a long time for a Terminator that actually ENJOYS killing, and can get excited at the prospect of finding an unexpected target.The T-X is a great concept... in theory. Combining both of the previous variants (T-1000-ish shapeshifting metal, covering an armed-to-the-teeth skeleton) is a logical extrapolation of the idea, and COULD have made her the most frightening Terminator yet.The action scenes involving Terminator and/or T-X were outstanding. Terrific fight scenes, particularly the "bathroom" fight, and the end of the truck-vs.-mobile-crane chase scene.There are a few parts of the movie that genuinely surprised me. I honestly didn't see the ending coming. (In hindsight, I should have.) Also, the explanation of how this particular Terminator came into the the human resistance's possession... Without spoiling anything, let's just say that it was quite chilling.THE ADEQUATE: This may be a matter of opinion, but I thought the T-X died a little too quickly and too easily, particularly for such potent villain.The human leads - John Connor (Nick Stahl), Kate Brewster (Claire Danes), General Brewster (David Andrews), etc. were OK, but that's all they were. None of them were able to dominate a scene like Kyle Reese (Michael Biehn) and Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton). These humans NEEDED Arnold on their side to make them interesting.It's the script's fault, not Nick Stahl's, but I'd hoped for more, much much more, from John Connor. In T2, Sarah Connor was absolutely larger-than-life (albeit insane); I could easily imagine Skynet fearing her. In this movie, we only see faint glimpses of that from John Connor, and IMHO that wasn't enough.The action scenes that didn't include either Terminator or T-X were relatively weak. Not horrible, but not particularly memorable either.The film is generally lighter than the previous two, both literally and figuratively. Fewer critical scenes took place at night, and there was more humor. This is both good and bad. The jokes generally worked, thanks largely to Arnold's deadpan delivery, and this movie didn't look or feel like a carbon copy of the previous two, as it easily could have. Still, much of the sense of urgency was lost.THE BAD: The T-X's capabilities, in practice, were inconsistently written, and sometimes distracted from the story. For example, how can she remotely drive four cars? Even if she is a super-whiz-bang computer, something in the cars has to physically push the pedals and turn the steering wheels.How can she "infect" a computer system that doesn't have any modems or interfaces? I think Arnold says something about "nanotechnology" but that drifts a little too far into technobabble.How does T-X mimic complex machines? Sure, I can imagine her having a blaster and a few critical power tools stored in her skeleton. However, I simply cannot accept her being able to turn her limbs into flame throwers, complicated gizmos, etc.I'll usually overlook technical details (these are just movies), but not when those details make it difficult for me to suspend my disbelief. Furthermore, none of those capabilities helped to advance the plot in any meaningful way; all could easily have been been written out. The basic concept behind the T-X is more than adequate, without resorting to magic tricks.Additionally, as other reviewers have mentioned, there are significant plot holes. I won't repeat or describe them here, since they'd be spoilers, but holes do exist. I'm anxious to see the deleted scenes when this movie comes out on DVD; It might help to explain things a bit better.Finally, as others have said, Linda Hamilton is sorely missed. I don't know why she wasn't included in T3, but hope that the choice was hers, and hers alone. If the producers didn't want her, or if they decided that her asking price was too high, bad call.CONCLUSION: I enjoyed T3, I'm glad I saw it, and I'll see it again. However I'll probably wait until it makes it's way to a second-run theater (ie. reduced ticket price). Once at full price is enough.Bottom line - Terminator and T2 were two of the all-time great movies. T3 was a very good popcorn movie (particularly during this very disappointing year) but it lacked greatness.

When I went to go see T3 today, I wasn't expecting much. This was forthree reasons:1) Its a modern day sequel based on great classic movies, and most modern sequels suck. 2) It wasn't directed or written by James Cameron. 3) How the hell could the story fit?! IT ENDED IN T2!So, I went in with not expecting much. God I was wrong. While it isn't as good as THE TERMINATOR or its sequel TERMINATOR 2: JUDGMENT DAY, I say it was very entertaining. The action sequences were good, and the story fit well into the existing time line. The acting was also very good. I was kind of disappointed that Edward Furlong didn't come back to play John Connor, and I was really hoping for a cameo of Linda Hamilton's Sarah Connor and Michael Biehn's Kyle Reese (I know he is dead, but he did make a cameo in T2, just watch the deleted scenes on the T2 Extreme DVD), but we can't have everything now, can we? I was also pleased that there were some very funny inside jokes to us Terminator fans.Also, the T-X was a pretty good ruthless villain, even though she will never compare to Robert Patrick's T-1000 or Arnold's original T-101. The movie also, of course, sets up for a sequel which will be very interesting (I'd tell you why, but then it would ruin the ending).Overall, it was pretty entertaining and better than expected.

TALK ABOUT A TREMENDOUS MOVIE!anyone who's anyone will watch this movie, that's how good it actually is. The movie is basicaly about John's final adventure with the T-800 before he faces the complete destruction of America. I, honestly, thought Jonathan Mostow was going to present to the audience an over-exaggerated sequel that had NOTHING to do with the actual terminator script. However, i was mistaken and pleasantly surprised. My suggestion is for people all around the world to go see this movie; it's worth watching. "TRUST ME".

Review title: What movie have you been watching ?
Review_body: ***** SPOILERS *****I would rate this movie a -10 out of 10, if it were possible. I don't mean to be rude but I just wonder if you have seen a completely different movie then I.The problem I have with the movie is that it offset the entire story compared to the first two movies. Now Skynet is a virus infected AI. Where did that come from ? Why didn't Reese know about it, why didn't the second terminator know about it, why didn't the third terminator know about it ?The first two were dark movies with an ever present danger, in this one all the comic reliefs make it more like a parody of the first two. To many focus on the mindless action relief. In T and T2 there was a thought with the action (T2 a bit less then the first), in T3 nothing. And what did they do with the excellent score ?In T3 they killed the essence of the first two, dark good story, action with brains and a score to match.As a huge fan of the first two I feel betrayed by this movie and would love to have it erased from my memory.

i thought this film was great definetely lived up two the last 2.the effects were amazing and u could see the 170 million in the movie.arnold as usual plays the terminator like he was born to do it.krisstina loken was great as the tx but not beeter than robert patrick in t2.claire danes was great as. kate brewster.but the shock performance of the movie was nick stahl he was excelent as john connor and u couldnt tell eddie furlong absence.linda hamilton as sarah o'connor was not at all missed but u could tell it wasnt directed by james cameron.jonathan mostow did a suberb job in directing this movie and adding an exxelant entry into this suberb francise.bring on t4

Finally -- A sequel, or the third to the series, that actually rocks!  I walked in the theater expecting to be disappointed.  I was way wrong!  The humor, action, and storyline was fantastic.  It doesn't get hokey or stupid, it keeps with the theme.  Spoiler: Looks like T4 is on the way!!!

To shoot a film down with one star from a possible 10 probably seems a little harsh, how ever i assure it is completely justified. For one, this movie is a sequel which is not coherent with either the narrative, spirit or story of the first two installments of the franchise. Poorly cast, Stahl and Daines (who are respectfully quite talented) fail to bring a sense of urgency when required, at times the dialogue is stilted and even the characters seem bored. Only one line devices have carried over from the previous installments, all of which feel tacky, like biting into yesterdays bread. i would mention that the work of Stan Winston in this film is excellent, and the only saving grace. This film offers nothing new, breaks no new ground and requires you strangle your disbelief rather than suspending it. A cash cow indeed.

Review title: Great Arnie movie, bad Terminator movie
Review_body: If this had "just" been the latest Arnie movie I would say that it had it all, great action pieces and some funny gags and dialouge, which is basically what I am looking for when i watch one of his movies. BUT as the third installment in the Terminator series there is only one thing to say: "Not good enough"!!!! there where way too many stupid one-liners(in an "ordinary" arnie movie it would be great), but for me it made it completely impossible to take him and the movie serious. one or two funny situations are ok, they where there in T2 as well. but this was way over the top!   The first movie where an action thriller, so was the second, (whith the focus on the action) but this sometimes looks like Rush hour 3!!!!  which is very very wrong in a Terminator movie!So I gave it 7, but with fewer stupid "funny" scenes it would have been 8

Beyond and over the protection of John Connor plus Kate Brewster (his future fiancé and co-commander against cyborgs), the film makes clear how and why those machines become self-function to destroy all human rather than repeatedly leave it as the matter of the future and insisting on mad individual fighting as in the first two only. It is an intelligent script despite the last one already showing that the microchip has been destroyed. The film suggests the fact that disaster, tragedy, impact is never avoidable as long as we - human - keep raising our power competition through the destructive technology. Regarding the film content, what I'd like to summarize is it could be the boring repetition, if there is nothing new within it in which the traditional storyline is always used for the dynamic images and narrative for its fans. This is - probably - why the script was created with the emphasis on the new issues in addition to keeping its typical form and content of Terminator which is widely perceived.Further to this, whoever loves the first two made by Cameron may get disappointed with this one while I whose abhorrence towards those feel it is what I have been waiting for. Anyway, I love all of them.

I loved this movie. I don't exactly know why I liked it so much, but I think it was just about everything.I liked the second movie, but I that T3 had a higher level of sophistication and maturity as it ought to. There is nothing finer than a well produced movie with a full orchestra and a good, well presented theme. The themes in the first and second movies where transparent and never narrated, but if you look at T3, you will notice that the theme is so prominant that not only is it included in the subtitle just as in the second movie, but also the theme is narrated by John C. which I think is very important for setting a mood and I would say is appropriate in a sci-fi movie such as this one. Throught the whole movie character developement is strong. Arnold's character is used as both a metaphore of total annihilation and a foil for Nick's more fleshy character, John. Briliant. Additionally, the movie has great visuals and the action wasn't so quick that the projector couldn't keep up. The action was however largescale and very exciting while believable.My only beef with this movie is that it was too good to only be 120 minutes long. That's what a lot of people have been complaining about and I think they're 100% right. Let's hope the DVD has lots of extra scenes!Good Day!

The Terminator series began with two thought provoking well done films. The second one, while incorporating mindless action, still stay true to the spirit of the original.  The third is contrived, derived, and shallow. LEss U571, more Terminator 1, please.  Thanks

Review title: A worthy sequel to a winding down franchise.
Review_body: CONTAINS MILD SPOILERS I expected to go to this movie and be extremely disappointed with it. The original director/writer James Cameron was missing, Arnold was getting caught up by his age, and it's been over a decade since T2. Instead I was actually quite satisfied with Jonathan Mostows take on Terminator.I thought that the character acting was quite well done. Nick Stahl wasn't exactly powerful with his performance as John Connor but this was a good thing because it seemed that the focus of the film was no longer on him anyways. Claire Danes while making a wonderful damsel in distress didn't really convince me that she was to be a key lieutenant of the future but I guess that's how Linda Hamilton's character was in the first film so it's all the more intriguing. Arnold's performance was of course perfect. He easily recaptured the Terminator persona and was even able to pull off some good humor with a straight face. Kristanna Loken's terminator did her job but wasn't really as intimidating as the original T-800 or the T-1000. Maybe because it was a woman this time I don't know. It's most likely the fact that I had the phrase "been there done that" echoing in my head since we all knew Arnold would win in the end.The plot was probably the weakest category of this film. Unlike T2 there wasn't really any good sub-plot to keep the viewer intrigued between explosions. However luckily the key pressure points and a surprise twist ending kept things interesting. Some claim this is just a rip-off of movies like the Matrix because it involves computers taking over the world. Those hippie Matrix fan boys should not be listened to since this has been the key concept for the last 19 years of the franchise!As for the action, some may complain it's pretty much the same as T2. Why is this a bad thing!? The chase scene alone was enough to give any action fan their fix. Anyone who says otherwise probably doesn't believe the phrase "if it ain't broke, don't fix it."Overall, I definitely recommend this film. Though not as strong as the first two films, it still kept the Terminator franchise on its feet and had decent entertainment value. It could have been worse and completely spoil the series like a certain three prequel films from a certain popular space fighting franchise from far, far away. If this is the last film, it didn't end with a bang but with a solid satisfying march out the door. If T4 is made then at least T3 held the bridge up instead of letting it crash down. 3 out of 5.

The main problem I had with Terminator 3: Rise of The Machines is that it's a film that feels a bit too familiar. While I would say that T3 does have many action sequences, that in itself is the problem. T3 feels like one long chase scene, but offers no real reward at the end.  Character development seems to be drowned in the relentless action, and the film suffers from it as a result. Also the plot line seems to be borrowed from its predecessor T2, making it very predictable, and somewhat outdated; especially when swartzenegger spills his famous line "I'll be back," that was popular over a decade ago. There is a fine light in the film, and that light comes in the form of Claire Danes, who plays an everywoman veterinarian. Danes adds a bright spot with her fine acting skills, but she seems as though she could have contributed more to the film, had the film actually focused on characters, rather than being forced to giveway to exploding cars, and other mindless action that would make a demolition derby seem sophisticated.

Again, there are some very strong spoilers.  I liked this movie a lot -- it was almost as good as the first, possibly slightly better.  The ending, and I won't say exactly what happens, sent some very strong chills down my spine.  The original had an almost perfect screenplay (aside from the fact that Kyle's flashbacks always end in certain death with no explanation of his escape), but there were some problems with acting and SFX.  The second one had no substance whatsoever.  In fact, one of my biggest complaints was that it reworked the handling of the time travel paradox -- in the first movie, the future created itself, while in the second, it prevented itself. They can't have it both ways.  If they had had this as the sequel (with a few changes), it would have been an improvement over the original, maybe even a perfect 10.  Sadly, the second movie dragged down the franchise. 7/10.

SPOILER ALERT!!!I loved it. What can i say! This movie is definitely my favorite of the series. Not only does it tell a great story, but it has awesome action scenes. The pacing is fast, just like the first Terminator film.The acting is top notch and the ending is just awesome. Not only is it thought provoking, but it is also very emotional.Ties in very well with T1 and T2, and it continues the mythology of John Connor in an excellent way. At the beginning of the film, he is a slacker who wants no part of his destiny. At the end of the film, he accepts his fate as the leader of the human resistance against Skynet.10/10

Ii have waited for this film for years, and let me tell you, it was worth the wait. The first time i watched T3, i came out with mixed feelings because all the scenes that i really wanted to see in the film were missing. I was really looking forward to seeing the CRS build T-1s and T-600/800 endoskeletons. Most of all, i wanted to see Chief Master Sergeant William Candy. When i watched the movie, i saw that many scenes were cut out. So, when i watched T3 for the second time, I LOVED IT. Things just fit together perfectly. T3 is definitely my favorite of the trilogy. IMO, it told the coolest story out of the three. We finally see Skynet's rise to power. Also, the story had heart and it had a soul. T3 was basically John Connor's story. At the beginning of the film, he is a slacker who wants no part of his destiny. At the end of the film, he finally accepts his fate as the leader of the human race. Nick Stahl gave a fantastic performance as John Connor, he made you care for the character and he actually made the character's inner emotional struggle throughout the film believable. Claire Danes was excellent as Kate Brewster. Kate is very much like the Sarah Connor of the first film. She is an innocent woman who is suddenly taken away from her life and put into a world full of terror and death. Kate is very important to the plot of the film and to the terminator story as a whole. Arnold is perfect as The Terminator, what else can i say? Kristanna Loken gave a great performance as the T-X. IMO, she was just as terrifying and menacing as Robert Patrick's T-1000. The rest of the cast does a fine job as well. The humor worked fine IMO, it was very similar to T2 in this aspect. The humor comes at the right time. To all the naysayers, this IS NOT a remake or a rehash of T2. It is a worthy continuation of the terminator story full of new and fresh ideas. The ending of the film is just awesome. Its probably the best ending in years. Same goes for the action and special effects. Stan Winston and ILM did an excellent job. Kudos to Jonathan Mostow to staying true to T-1 and T2 and giving us a terrific third installment. Hopefully, he will return for T4, which will be the full future war film. 10/10

Review title: The sequel that breaks the trilogy curse!
Review_body: I've been waiting 12 years for a new Terminator movie. Having watched T-1 and T-2 roughly 50 times each, I would consider myself a huge Terminator fan.This movie delivers the best movie of the year, and its doubtful very many movies could top this (aside from possibly ROTK, should it be good).John Mostow provides an interesting, new perspective on the franchise. Having been dissapointed with most of Camerons recent work, I am very glad he did this movie.The acting in the movie is pure gold, some of the best active I've seen. Arnold, Nick, Kristanna and Claire prove to be equal to any of the actors in the previous versious of the franchise.Action scenes are equal to both T-1 and T-2 in terms of intensity, possibly surpasing both.The pacing of the movie is very well done. Having been saddened by the poor job on Matrix : Reloaded, this movie (aside from a 5 second scene) has excellent pacing. DO NOT expect to get a chance to get up and goto the bathroom.I've read that some film critics claim that this Terminator doesn't have a story, nor a heart (compared to either of the earlier movies) is rather wrong. The theme of the movie is different from T-1 and T-2.Unlike T-1 and T-2, which have messages of hope during horrible circumstances, T-3 heart lies in inevitability, fate and destiny. John's portrayl of hopelessness is excellent.*Possible Spoilers*The movie does take about 15 minutes to start up, but after that, is excellent. The direction of how the machines take over is brilliant. I was stunned at the portrayl of the actual rise of the machines. Even though there is a lack of future war scenes, the movie makes up in the beginning of the war. I doubt that any director could do a better job.The only complaints I could have in the movie is the 5 second scene where Arnold puts on his glasses for the first time, which was humorous, but not needed. As well as the fact the movie didn't quite have the B-rated sheen that the first 2 had.I was suprised at 2 things which pleased me, the suspence and violence. Mostow did a better job with these 2 things than either Terminator.*End possible Spoilers*Having said all that, I'd look at it this way, on a scale of 1-10T-1 = 9.75 T-2 = 9.30 T-3 = 8.75-9.00Go see this movie, and if you've seen it, see it again!

As a fan of both previous Terminator films, I wasn't expecting much from the third.  Need I say Alien 3?  I was hoping that they wouldn't detract from the true basis of Terminator and they haven't.It keeps the plot and actually fits quite well.  There are no "let's tack this on so that we have a plot for the third film" extrapolations, we finally find out what type of machine SkyNet is.It has a touch of humour but nothing that stops it from being a Terminator film.  Sometimes you are watching the screen for minutes at a time during the action scenes, not because it's a massive fight, just for the ideas that the characters use to get their own way.The Arnie Terminator is a bit meaner than the one in Terminator 2, less human.  The new female Terminator isn't as rubbish as the trailers show. The computer graphics are used sparingly and only where they're needed.John Connor isn't the world leader you expect him to be, but that's because he hasn't gotten there yet.  The character seems to follow from Terminator 2 quite well, though.There are no glaring movie-isms... the new technology is pretty and not too elaborate.  Computers look like computers, the city like a city etc.All in all, worth a watch for fans of both the first films.

it's weird.  when i saw matrix reloaded i definitely enjoyed it.  but when critics and fans alike began to dismiss it, saying it wasn't a good movie and was completely stupid and ridiculous, i didn't argue.  i didn't like it enough, it didn't leave me with anything to bother trying to defend it. what do you say?  "but the story was good!"  it really wasn't.  "the action scenes were great!"  yeah, that's why we all saw it in the first place. same with "hulk".  i liked it.  i'm not going to defend it.
terminator 3 though...this has been the best and most enjoyable action movie this summer.  the story - for how little attention they gave it - worked just fine and was easily understandable.  no need to see it a second time to figure out what the hell they're talking about.  i'll see it again just because it was sooooooooooooo freaking enjoyable!  i mean hulk?  matrix? even x2!  these aren't action movies!  terminator 3 is an action movie, best one i've seen in a while.  suspense!  there was actual suspense!  yeah! and the end?  oh no!  very good, good stuff.  i will take it personally when people say they didn't like this movie.  i will defend it.  take note of the small details in this movie.  they're important, and they ARE there.  "it would've been soooo much better if cameron had directed it."  comparisons are stupid.  just because it's a franchise doesn't mean you should compare directors.  except if it's george lucas, who somehow screwed his own franchise by being the director. let me direct episode 3.

Review title: Without Cameron at the helm, Arnie and co descend into parody
Review_body: The director certainly knows how to control big action scenes as evidenced in the likes of Breakdown and U-571 yet the the scriptwriters have lost the plot when it comes to. plot, and there is far too much parody, turning Arnie into a caricature, like he is in the Simpsons.This just doesn't feel like a Terminator movie.  It's more like a cover version, say The Datsuns covering an AC/DC song.Some of Arnie's lines are so bad such as `It's time', `I'm back' and, probably the most embarrassing part in the film, when he tells a guy at a checkout `talk to the hand'.We knew it was coming, we knew it was never gonna be as good as part 2, and it isn't.On the plus side, the new TX is very fit in her cherry red leather outfit and there are some really funny scenes and a couple of good action scenes.

Wow this movie was so awesome, Arnold can still kick butt and the New TX gives him a good challenge. The sound was the best for this picture it blew me away because it was non stop action. only thing i didnt like was the comic relief that didnt belong in this movie. But overall it was AWESOME. I think there will be a T4 because arnold does say "We'll Meet Again" but im worried he will not be in the next one because it took them 11 years since they had T2 and im afraid theres not going to be another for at least 10 years more by then Arnold will be too old and he will not star in it.

*************************POSSIBLE SPOILERS*************************I went in to this movie expecting just another sequel, man was I wrong! This movie surpased all of my expectations. The ending was, I think, the best possible ending for the movie, it completely surprised me & I will not forget it any time soon. The car chase after the vet's was better than The Matrix Reloaded's, which was overrated. Arnold did a surprisingly good job at his 3rd time being the Terminator, many of his lines are humorous without being corny. The T-X was pretty cool but the T-1000 would own her any day of the week except on Mondays because that's the day that he gets the nerve endings in his face disabled because that man has THE coldest face I've ever seen. The few scenes of the missiles launching & landing at the end were also very cool &, to me, gave the movie a better sense of being a reality. I highly recommend this movie, it is truly worthy of the Teminator name.Note: You have to see the 1st two movies before you see this one or else you'll get very confused.

This movie had by far the best action scenes and special EFX I've ever seen. Now whether or not it stacks up with T2 or not, personally I don't care. I will say, however, I did go into this movie with very little expectations so perhaps thats why I enjoyed it so much. I was pleasantly surprised.  In a era of mindless summer blockbusters, maybe we all should just put our brains to bed for a bit and go out and be entertained.  Not all of us are long-haired, overweight, losers who still live at home and have aspirations of attending film school and directing the next great sci-fi epic.  So, for all you other folks, I highly recommend this flick.  Arnold is funnier than ever and the mindless action actually develops a bit of a brain about 45 minutes in which does help greatly.  9/10

Review title: Good, but not as great as T2!!!
Review_body: A good sequel to a long running, and quite extraordinary saga. Arnold still maintains his physique and "terminator-style" attitude. I particularly was really impressed with the CGI and special effects. A must see for die-hard "Terminator" and Arnold fans alike.

Review title: A Good Continuation of the Story
Review_body: Humor mixed with action adventure.  I loved it!  I only wish John Conner was tougher, as he would have been having gone through the last movie and having been raised by Sarah C.  Look for the scene with the psychiatrist - he is also in the second movie but the humor will be lost on you if you don't notice that.

Review title: excellent addition to the other terminators
Review_body: Terminator 3, Rise of the Machines was an awsome movie.  The special effects and chase scenes were very cool.  Even though James Cameron did not direct this other guy did a good job.  Schwarzenegger had a lot of funny one liners.  The TX was one thing that was wrong.  She did not look very intimidating for a deadly machine.  I thing the T1000 was more dangerous.All in all there is not much to say about the movie except that it was an awsome action movie that was definately worth seeing.I give it 9/10 stars

Okay i just saw the premier and its pretty good. I give it a 7 out of 10. There are some plot holes that they needed to fill, but other then that pretty good. The T-X is sooooo hot. The Actor playing John Conner does a so so job. I liked most of the movie, but found my self questioning many of the things that i have come to learn about the future. I can't wait for T-4 Fall of the machines. You know it's going to happen? This movie did nothing else but leave me wanting more..

I am a big fan of James Cameron's work and checked t3 out with the mindset that I may be disappointed.  The film did work a little too much off of the cliche lines from 1 and 2 but the film was rather interesting and the plot twists were pretty good.

i just rented terminator dawn of fate for ps2 and i found out that it was the prequel to terminator 1 it's what happened before t1 it was the war and if u wanna see the prequel or the war buy or rent the game (i wouldnt buy cause its too short, i beat it in 5 hours.

Review title: The best terminator out of the 3!
Review_body: It's has a LOT of action and a little comedy and drama. that combo's into a great MOVIE! :) you find out some very interesting things in this movie about John Connor! If you like Terminator movies you have to see this movie! I'd give it a 10 out of 10!

Review title: This movie deals a blow to newbie directors...
Review_body: I'd almost say ignore the previous poster's comments. This movie was a low blow to film directors who are starting out. Not only does its storyline override the work that James Cameron created, the movie was so full of cliches and lame jokes that.. well... I want my money back.Skynet's concept was totally redone. The history of the Terminator as well as John Connor's future was re-written. And my god, the last 5 minutes.... it was as if all of the cheese in Hollywood was crammed into the last 5 minutes of this movie.My opinion is that they're gearing up for a LOVE movie in T4... something remeniscent of Romeo+Juliet.For the love of God, don't see this movie. See something else.

Review title: Setting up the Story for T4?
Review_body: The Terminator is back. Arnold fans won't be disappointed, this movie is action, action, action. T3 movies so fluidly that you don't realize you've been sitting in a  theatre for 90 minutes, which is an ode to the talented James Cameron. Claire Danes has grown up and plays a good damsel in distress. Nick Stahl just seems to exist in the film only to give a body to John Conner, but with all the car chases, gun battles, and explosions most people aren't going to notice. Arnold has still got it. I was not disappointed. The action is non stop, the plot is pretty decent, and it has a twist ending that is inviting another sequel.

I was completely surprised and impressed by this movie!  The acting was great!  The story was great!  and I think everyone that sees it will have a fun time! Nick Stahl (John Connor) does an amazing job!  I don't think they could have picked anyone better.

Review title: Best Film Of The Summer!!! Listen To Me!!!
Review_body: Just as everyone else, I walked into the theater very skeptical, pretty doubt ridden about this 3rd installment. You all know the reasons, I'll skip those. At age 24, I now have matured as a filmgoer in the sense that I can really indentify a well made flick when I see one. Listen to me when I say that T3 is not only the best film of the summer, but of the best of the year.Those out there that are tired of CGI dominated action flicks will especially appreciate the large, large amount of stunt work done to avoid as much CGI as possible. The film has more action sequences than any other action flick before, and the best part is none of it is overkill, it's all necessary for the plot. The screenplay really blew me away, it was reported that Schwartzenegger went through several scripts until he found the one that struck him hard. I will not give anything away but it really allows for great acting turns from the whole cast (Schwartzenegger is in absolute top-form) specifically Mr. Stahl and Ms. Danes who have incredible chemistry.Matrix Reloaded, Hulk, 2 Fast 2 Furious, and other soon to be big budget dissapointments cannot hold a candle to T3, proving once again that a Terminator flick will always destroy every other entry into the sci-fi genre. Oh and I almost forgot to mention the T-X Ms. Lokken who is blazingly sexy and dangerous, was a great casting call. I rate this film a SOLID 10 OUT OF 10, it was definately every second of the 12 years we had to wait, so get out of your seat and shut down your computer and get your keister into the theater, for 109 minutes of the most fun you can have!!!

Lets just say like any self-respecting man I am an extreme fan of the terminator films.  From the moment I saw Arnold knock on a door and ask "Sarah Connor?" followed by smashing through it and absolutely going to town on her with a gun to make sure the woman died, I knew I had found that edgy sci-fi gold.  The Terminator had it all.  Action, cat and mouse games, sci-fi, originality, humor, and above all the ability to make you believe in what you were seeing.  Then guess what, a few years later a sequal came and blew it away.  Terminator 2 still stands as one of my favorite films of all time.  It had everything the first had and then some.  Emotion, state of the art special effects (which are now the mainstream), and more.  I can still watch that movie over and over.  It not only stands the test of time, it created the term "Better than the first!!"  Now, years later a third terminator film is being released.  Believe me, if you're a terminator fan you should be excited as hell.  Not worried.  I was able to check out the film last night, and before it began I thought to myself, "If there's one thing I hope they don't mess up, please let it be the FEEL of the other two movies."  Jonathan Mostow, I applaud you.  I was a fan of your work before but I am extremely grateful you kept this franchise together.  I love the way you worked in everything.  This is as good a sequal as any and it fits in perfectly with the first two.  The acting is top-notch, Kristinna Loken stands out as the baddy.  Ah-nuld is back in full form, and the rest of the cast is simply amazing as well.  Also, this is by far the funniest film of the trilogy.  This movie has it all.  The best car chase EVER!!! (yes, it blows away the matrix reloaded), the best fight scenes in a long time (I'm sick of every movie, unless it's the matrix franchise, having bullet-time effects and gravity defying kicks), the best story of the three films. It's all here and it's all amazing.  I couldn't find one thing I disliked. It's an awesome achievement.  It's a fitting sequal.  It's a fun ride.  It's a thought provoker.  It's a Classic.

Review title: Cameron has the action, but Mostow packs the laughs
Review_body: I had always worried about someone else taking over the Terminator saga from James Cameron...something on the line of an Indiana Jones movie without Spielberg.  But I needn't have worried.  Jonathan Mostow has done a killer job with the continuation of the series (yes, I did say series and not trilogy)  Similar to the funny parts of Red Dragon, we find ourselves laughing uncontrollably at the exploits of the new T-101.  If anything is missing from the flick, it's the loss of a Brad Fiedel score...the one chase scene is virtually void of music in comparison to T2's canal chase. Would have liked to see how the movie would have been with Edward Furlong back as John Connor, but Nick Stahl does a respectable job---the local reviewer said he seemed like he'd get beat up quickly, but that's the WHOLE POINT...this is the story of how John learns to take responsibility for his inevitable destiny.  Go see this movie...twice.

Review title: fortunately i got in for free
Review_body: i was so hyped up to see this movie. from the day i first heard it was announced to the week of its release, it was the one movie i was actually looking forward to. buddy of mine that worked at our local cinema-plex got me in for free and i sat down with only the best of intentions. i knew something was wrong the minute the opening credits came up and "holy sh*t?! wheres the all to familiar Terminator theme by Brad Fiedel?" i almost wanted to cry. by the end of the movies i had more questions than just those to ask. like why did they send poor Arnold's model back to fight off the T-X? the t-800 vs. the t-1000 wasnt so bad and it put Arnold at a little disadvantage and made him have to outwit the thing. if they were even, then it wouldnt have been interesting. but the t-800 vs. the t-x wasnt even remotely fair. its like a toaster vs. a flamethrower. what the hell were the story writers thinking?acting wise, the movie was average. Arnold played his part as the emotionless cyborg excellently as usual. Nick Stahl was pretty convincing as the future leader John Connor and Claire Danes was just there. nothing really standing out in her role. Newcomer Kristanna Loken played the T-X very well. Unfortunately the new female terminator just didnt seem as terrifying as the previous terminators and really didnt give you that sense of hopelessness and despair as Robert Patrick's and Arnold's previous terminator roles did. you wanna be scared of the terminator, not drool over it. but i guess that was the whole point. drool and be scared at the same time.overall, Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines was an entertaining summer flick and one of the better big-budget action movies released in a while. the ending was one that made you think yet very dissapointing. kinda like terminator sorta kinda maybe 2.5. i think James Cameron's direction would have been much better. an average action flick with the Terminator name stamped on it.

Well, after being treated to a sneak preview Tuesday night, I must say that this film is not what I originally expected.  The odds were against it: No Cameron, no Hamilton, no Eddie Furlong, but lo and behold, T3 is something of a masterpiece.  Not a perfect masterpiece, mind you.  But one truly worthy of note.It has been a long time since a Terminator film graced theaters, and many people thought that was due to script rewrites and such, when actually the original Carolco Pictures company went bankrupt sometime after the second film.  Legal battles ensued for years, and finally a phoenix rose from the ashes.  But enough of this prologue, is it good?From the unique presentation of the beginning (interwoven clips of the future and present-day footage) to the stirring action sequences (which unfortunately, harbor my only gripe), I was truly amazed with Jonathan Mostow's work.  I noticed that one review cited a plot hole:  the machines couldn't have reinstituted SkyNet because Arnold and the T-1000 were killed in the first one.  Well, one possibility is the arm.  Though it is not mentioned in the third installment, we all remember Arnold losing an arm in the second film, which was not destroyed.  Totally plausible.  There are other criticisms, but that was the most outspoken.  My only problems are the action sequences.  Yes they're great, and yes, the CG characters used in the scenes look more realistic than the Matrix Reloaded's Neo...but, sometimes there are too many cuts, and you lose track of where the action is.  Not enough wide establishing shots, too many closeups.  Of course a film is more cost-effective that way.All in all, great acting, a great script, and amazing special effects make this film enjoyable, but what makes it remarkable is its subtle touch of heart.  Go see it, bring your family, and remember Arnold's last words in this movie, "We will meet again."  Sequel?

Review title: Pretty Good, but too short (mine was 1 hour 42 min), and does NOT beat T2
Review_body: Well, the movie in no way was bad. After all, the Judgement Day we heard about in T1 and T2 start in this movie. but still, I did not find the essence of the hardcore terminator, as there were several places where kiddy and babyish stuff was happening. But I would recommend it to all Terminator fans out ( Like Me). I think there might be a T4, since the ending was not proper. Arnie says "We will meet again" in the end of the movie, and I think the last sentence said in the movie was "The Battle has just begun ". So, I sure hope there is a T4, which really kicks ass, but I dont want to wait another 10 years or so for it...

A very poor film indeed! They creators have ditched plot, narrative, character development for some random explosions and not much else. Arnie barely spoke more than one liners, (or a few words in a sentence) and the other casting choices were a mistake to say the least.An open ended film which obviously makes way for another Terminator film. I cannot believe that they did this to the Terminator series, the first film was awesome (easily the best) and the second was quite good for its time.
