Is it even possible to destroy her?The lines in T1 and T2 did seem like they were 'right on', but like the other reviews have said, T3 just seemed a little off here and there.  And just 'appearing' in a top secret base with weapons loaded is a BIG stretch. Did they cut a scene or two to get it under two hours??I could watch T1 and T2 a few times, but I was disappointed with T3.All your base are belong to us.

It was great seeing the T800 back and his relationship with John Connor. "Hasta La Vista, remember? No that was a different model." I also liked the cameo from the doctor from the first 2 films. I like this movie for the nostalgia. I went into the theater not knowing what to expect, so i was pleasantly suprised. The new TX is hot and plays a good villian. This is a different film than the first 2 but remember that the first 2 films were also different from each other. I can't compare it to the first 2 because i was a kid when i saw them. I actually saw T2 at the theater when it first came out. Theres no way to compare the feeling i had when i saw that to this, it was a different feel. Without giving anything away i really liked the ending.t3 - 8/10

Review title: Great movie, must see! Arny still kicks butt.
Review_body: The action of this movie was intense. The stunts were well thought of, and well done. The plot is great. T1 was pre skynet, T2 was present skynet, T3 is future skynet. Even with the T-X model sent back to destroy Connor and his leutenants, the T-101 still is the force to be tested.

Awesome action and special effects, nice actress (Kristanna Loken as TX), humour, I think Terminator 3 is a suitable continuity of terminator 1-2 (you will notice it in the begining) as it it one of my favorite film ever! Long life to "The rise of machines"!!!

When compared to the first and second Terminator movies, T3 is probably average at best.The special effects were top notch but the movie seemed forced. Whereas the first and second at times grew deep and philosophical (or as much as this storyline would allow), T3 had none of that. It was just action scenes mixed in with ho-hum dialogue to explain what was about to happen next.Terminator 2 technically was a sequel, but it didn't *feel* like a sequel. T2 could have stood on its own.Terminator 3, on the other hand, pretty much assumes that the viewer is familiar with the storyline. Old characters (just one really) are shamelessly plugged in for quick appearances that didn't further the storyline one bit. New characters have been added and their histories faked to appear as if they've always been a part of the Terminator world. The movie watched as if it was the last season of some long running television series overdue for retirement.On the plus side, T3 has some strengths. As mentioned earlier, the special effects were excellent. Also, the writers gave the Terminator some hilarious moments.This is a short movie and the action moves briskly. Watch it if you're a fan of the series or if you're into awesome action scenes, but don't expect it to be very deep. 6 out of 10.

Review title: As good as the first sequel?
Review_body: I have been waiting to see this movie for 10 years... Imagine the amount of expectations I have had time to build up during this time! ;) So, did Terminator 3 deliver what I was hoping for? The answer is YES, and then some!!! I am very impressed! I won't give away anything, but even the most hardcore Terminator fan will be proud to see the end result! And if you haven't seen the first two, you probably will after watching this one...You simply HAVE to see this movie, and you cannot wait until you can find it at blockbuster!

Review title: (Possible Spoiler) Special Effects were very good
Review_body:
After 12 years the FX has been improved over T2. It is not as good as T2, however it will still be one of the biggest movies of the summer. Arnold paid $1.4 mil. for one of the scenes that was to be cut due to budget. The movie was full of action from the start, however the ending was disapointing. John Conner is not as strong a character as he was in T2.
(Warning following may contain plot spoilers) . . . .
T3 is very similar to the Original 1984 version in overal plot and ending. There may be a T4 in the future?

When I first heard that there was going to be another Terminator movie (T3), I cringed. I couldn't possibly imagine how they could explain there way out of how the last one ended. All of SkyNet had been destroyed with the last terminator, so in my mind there was no need for another movie. But I went anyway; I couldn't pass up on the chance that it would be worth seeing. And I was NOT disappointed at all; this movie was one of my top ten movie experiences. The movie had incredible special effects, as you would expect, without being over the top to the point of disbelief. The action was non-stop, realistic, and supported the movie. There were no useless action scenes, just to have action. The acting wasn't as bad as I thought it would be, in fact I thought it was well acted. Being an action movie there wasn't a lot of dialog but when there was the actors sold their parts very well. Overall, I would say this is a great flic, worth the price of admission, and something that I will see again in the theater. I highly recommend it. 9\10

This is a rare chance to see a decent 3rd installment of a great franchise. T3 had a pretty good plot, great acting, and the same subtle humor that was delivered in T2. T3 isnt as good as T2 (T2 revolutionize action films along with the first matrix) but is better than the first. Great use of CG, i didnt even relieze it was fake. Although some parts of the movie are a drag and some parts can get confusing, ultimatly i would recommend T3 to anyone intrested in a fun action movie with our favorite action man Arnie.

This movie is typical of a sequel, it is not as good as the original(s). There are certain things missing from this movie that the first two have, such as the terror of interacting with the Terminator. The script is reduced to a string of one liners, which are cute, but overdone.Overall, this movie is worth seeing, the stunt work and special effects are excellent, but don't expect it to be at the same level of the first two.

Review title: Like watching an expensive B Movie.
Review_body: Spoiler info and personal thoughts in here.I set my expectations on low just expecting to see more of a continuation of T2.  This way I wouldn't be disappointed.  That was way too high to set the bar.  As much as I love Arnold they couldn't have watched this and thought it was good.Remote controlling cars from the early part of the movie was an indication of how bad things were going to get.  WHY?  Totally un-necessary and downright dumb.Too Many Jokes.  He's not human and didn't need so many 80's style one-liners.  It was almost like watching the Brady Bunch Movies where they just mock the whole Brady Bunch theme.Why wasn't she more upset about losing her fiancé?  She got over it awfully quick.There was no need for a romance between the characters.The truck magically bounces over the girl to hit the terminatrix perfectly. Rewrite that scene.  It was painfully dumb.Better acting on the general's part and some military resistance would have helped.  Where were the military personnel?Why when the police were shooting them in the Hearse did they never hit a window where conners was hiding?  Why couldn't he have killed the swat members?  He's the Terminator with Barney programming?The Terminator fights my re-programming scene?  Ouch.  Very Lame.More of the Takeover of the machines in the base would have been better. That was your real chance to capitalize on the movie and you have 2 lame fight scenes and its over.  And how did conner and the girl get in there so easily?  What's with the lame missile through the window with the lamest missile explosion ever?  Might as well have been a bottle rocket.The real question is where did they spend the so-called 180 million?When did Conner become such a wuss.I get the feeling this movie was just thrown together and never thought out at all.  It's cheesy and dumb.  Could have been very good with about a dozen or two changes but just never delivers.  Recall the movie now before the weekend and fix it before its reputation is ruined.

Review title: Possibly the best of the series, definitely the best movie of summer 2003.
Review_body: I was very impressed with T3.  It is definitely better than T2, and quite possibly even better than the original Terminator.  Of the many movies I've seen this summer, this was by far the best: it is the most well written, has the best action, and even contends for the best humor.  I haven't been this engaged and drawn into a movie since "Fellowship of the Ring" came out a year and a half ago.  The characters are very well written and acted, and the plot remained true to the first two movies.  In fact, I think that the series as a whole makes more sense now that T3 has been added to it.  I would recommend this movie to anyone who is comfortable with the R rating.

Review title: Up there with Hot Shots and Robin Hood men in tights
Review_body: Not really sure the direction the director was heading with the the third installment of the terminator series but definately not anywhere I would have liked it to gone.  It was almost as if Mostow took everything from the previous terminators and made them into a joke in this one.  Yes we all know that the terminator has to find clothes somewhere but the director has to make a joke out of it.  The terminator is a machine.  He would not know whether sunglasses were considered socially feminine.  I dont understand. I sat there and laughed the entire time I was watching the movie.  I wasn't laughing with the director but at just how horrible it was.  The jokes were funny in that way that you laugh because they are incredibly stupid.  Its almost as if it should have been a pg-13 kids movie aside from the swearing and blood.  I am a pretty big fan of the Terminator series, especially the first one, and was very dissapointed.  The first terminator had a very dark, intense style which was lost a little with the second one but still executed.  Everything that was good about the other ones was gone.  The acting was horrible, the plot was simple, and the tone was childish.  The movie is wraught with cheesey one liners and taglines and seemed unable to get passed that.  I feel sorry for James Cameron.  He must be crying right now.  The change is comparable to that Batman series.  Batman and Batman returns were good and then it all just went hollywood corporate.  The thing that suprised me the most was coming online and seeing that it was almost hard to find a bad review.  I guess that what I thought was cool about the first two was not what all the terminator nerds thought was cool. Its worse than what happened to the star wars series.  They thought the jokes were funny and all the talked about were the action sequences.  The first one had very little big budget action but it made up for it in story-line and suspense.  Try watching the first and third movies back to back and you can truly see how stupid the series has gotten.  Oh well, there were a few redeeming scenes that I can hopefully convince myself was worth the 8 bucks. The movie was a big cheesey joke. Don't see this movie unless your a big dork.

Review title: T1 and T2 were Sci-fi landmarks but...
Review_body:
when treated as a stand alone, T3 is a highly entertaining film.
Ah-nold is still doing his thing in a major way. Here's hoping that the storywriters keep the twists and surprising with the indomitable Terminator. Kristanna Loken is a knockout. Her coldness and mercilessness is memorable. Nick Stahl and Clare Danes are engrossing actors. Stahl reminds me of Michael Biehn and Danes of a young Linda Hamilton. All in all, the acting is very good.

Review title: Arnolds ripped and back in black... sweet!
Review_body: If you haven't seen this movie yet, you owe it to yourself to watch it.As a big fan of the Terminator series, it's kinda hard to imagine one being made without James Cameron in the director's chair but Jonathan Mostow does a great job.Terminator movies always have alot of action and this movie isn't any different. The T-X makes a great villain and good enough to surpass the T-1000 in the second movie. She (loosely here) kills her victims almost as ruthlessly as the T-1000.The story is the most important part of this film and any plot holes that I had were patched up upon second viewing of this movie. It's well written and fits in with the other movies.This sequel is done with great respects to the previous installments, and if you enjoyed T2 (who didn't?) then you'll enjoy this movie too!

I was a little reluctant to go see Terminator 3.  I figured that it has been over 10 yeaers since T2 and I didn't think that the franchise would be able to support a third movie.  I was WRONG. The movie expands on the history of the series and manages to answer that question of "if we destroyed SkyNet, how is there a third movie?" quite well. Arnold does another excellent job of portraying the stony and unemotional T-800, and Kristanna Loken does an amazing job as the new Evil Treminatrix.  Of course the fact that she is a beautiful blonds in a sexy outfit does not hurt the movie either. All in all, this is the first good movie of 2003.  I went in expecting a good action movie with maybe a little depth too it and T:3 delivered in Spades.  The movies starts Fast and never lets you get back into your seat while manageing not to skip the angst of knowing what the future is going to bring and the fear of having to live up to expectations.I give this movie a solid 9.

Mostow has injected a lot of the same spirit from previous Terminator films into Terminator 3, cleverly causing you to undergo a bit of what weightlifters call `muscle memory.' Although wildly entertaining and pleasantly reminiscent of past films, Terminator 3 as a whole did not resonate like the first two films. That's not to say it didn't achieve greatness, just not the type of greatness Cameron achieved in the good old days. The key change from Cameron to Mostow proved too dissonant for some fans. Cameronistas resent Mostow's style as action over substance. Reading their remarks on the movie forums would have one believe the film represents more of a lowering of humans than rising of machines. T3 is not T2. Mostow is not Cameron. Let James Cameron be James Cameron, or at least Jim Cameron, and let everyone else be themselves.Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines had to hold its ground and simply not be bad. It held. It did more than that. It succeeded. Humor, action, and preservation of the Terminator motifs gave the film life. The word `terminated' will continue to live as a great movie euphemism. Whether or not the Terminator series will rise again, only time will tell.
--Emory Rowland

DAMN! I thought it was going to be a pile of junk with cool effects and bad acting, BOY was i wrong... It was almost better than T1 and T2....Geez!I was sincerely impressed with the acting, casting, effects, story, music etc...Just loved it...Cant wait to get it on DVD.Ill be waiting for T4 with passion!GG Jonathan Mostow!

Review title: AWESOME EFFECTS, BUT SLIGHTLY DISAPPOINTING STORY
Review_body: I had enormous expectations from this movie, and from all the stars, but in the end, I was a bit disappointed. My first thoughts were, "I think this movie misses James Cameron". But, we have to be fair to Mostow. Who can stand up to a challenge as great as this - continuing the Terminator series, especially when T2 was such a big hit.As expected, the special effects were unbelievable !! It's amazing what you can make pple think they're watching, these days. But I felt that the movie didn't have any direction. The chases just kept going on and on, and I didn't quite understand what was happening.All the actors did pretty well. Arnold was excellent as usual, Claire Danes was made for that Kate Brewster role, and Stahl was not bad. Although it was a little strange to see a female Terminator (I'm not trying to be sexist) as strong as the T-X, Loken did well.The movie was definitely very entertaining. The action was very good, special effects amazing, with some good laughs. It didn't give you a chance to get up and take a leak (there was no intermission !). I would definitely recommend it to any action/sci-fi movie or Arnold fan.Overall, I think this movie deserves a 9 out of 10.

Out of all the big movies released (X2, Matrix 2, Hulk, etc) this one is the best!  Non-stop action, a solid cast with top-notch acting, and a very good ending.  I didn't actually expect much since Cameron wasn't directing T3 but it turned out to be a pleasant surprise!  See this in the theatre while you can!

Review title: As good as the orignial...Loved it
Review_body: Done so well, the action and the story line moved right along.  I was caught up in the story within minutes of the movie starting.  Just tell me how Arnold S. stays so young looking.  He hasn't changed at all from the original movie.  All the actors were good.  Would see again and for me thats saying a lot.  Recommeded to all my friends.

Review title: To think: I'm criticizing Arnold for showing TOO MUCH emotion
Review_body: Poor writing and poor directing plagued this film.  The characters simply weren't who they were supposed to be.John Connor (Nick Stahl) who was trained in weapons and warfare from childhood by his mother dealt unflinchingly with the threat of the T-1000 as a 13 year old boy now appears to be a scared and confused drifter who freezes under pressure and exudes none of the confidence or ingenuity he did a decade ago.The T-X (Kristanna Loken) is cartoony.  In place of ruthless efficiency for which the terminators are known she kills sadistically.  Rather then relentlessly pursuing her enemy she seems to saunter and pose in what I can only assume is an attempt to build suspense.   And in the end, she simply isn't that frightening of a villain.Arnold was the biggest disappointment if only because he played the role with far too much of a human feel.  He has emotional conversations with John Connor, appears angry and surprised at times, and has a number of one-liners during action sequences that require far more wit than a machine with no emotion should be capable of.The sound was absurd.  When the terminator or the T-X was hit with something heavy we were greeted by a cartoony "boink" rather than something realistic. The soundtrack also lacked all of the attitude and intensity that truly set the atmosphere for the first two movies.*spoilers*And the continuity errors and unanswered questions ruined any hope of a story the movie may have hadTerminator 2 tells us that terminators (at least stock terminators) can't learn.  Arnie clearly does, after learning and reciting the "talk to the hand" phrase.Terminator 1 tells us that The Terminators were only sent back to kill John as a last ditch effort once the resistance had destroyed the skynet core. Now, Skynet doesn't have a core at all.Why would the US government leave a secret, high grade fallout shelter COMPLETELY unguarded?How did John, Kate, and a 6 foot tall terminator in black leather make it to the command center of a busy high tech military research facility without authorization and while carrying loaded weapons?  And why isn't anyone surprised to see them there until shooting starts?While the T-X can control machines, how can she remotely move the gear shift of a car from park to drive, an action that requires physical interaction?If, as T2 suggests, the concept of skynet was only made possible by the discovery of the pieces of the destroyed terminator from T1, how was it possible in T3 after John Connor destroyed all remnants of the terminators sent back through time?Unfortunately I could go on and on from here.  From the final product it appears as though the writers spent less time on the script for this movie than I did on this review

Review title: If you are a fan, you will be disappointed! Want a parody of the previous two movies, you will love it!
Review_body: I just want to warn people for this movie. If you are a big fan of the previous Terminator movies, I'm sorry but you will get disappointed. This is a bad movie! This is not a third Terminator movie with all the thrills, action and story telling that the last two movies offered. It is an action comedy with the typical Hollywood explosions and a bombard of bad jokes that totally "terminate" the seriousness of the movie. it's very easy to get Star Wars 1 flashbacks. with other words it's not worth the money!!

Well, so far I haven't read too many compliments about this film. (I did like it, that's for sure). All of you people have to realize that T2 was 12 years ago - the effects were new, and we hadn't seen this many sci-fi-action movies back then. You have to keep this in mind when you watch this film. Nowadays we're kind of overwhelmed by computer-generated effects, blood, sex, car chases, etc. This can be the reason why we haven't experienced the same "breakthrough-feeling" after watching T3. Think about it.Note: we were also twelve years younger then (compare Star Wars episodes in this context).Great movie, Schwarzenegger is simply the best. Rate: 9/10

I honestly am shocked at how bad this movie was.  The acting was laughable: at times you could almost see "John Conner" looking for a cue.  If this comes anywhere close to making a dime I will be surprised.  The action sequences were silly, the dialogue was CHEESY, and the story almost seemed like a farse.  I almost hope for a sequel just so the story can be salvaged, but don't hold out hope for an improvement without a James Cameron.

I suppose there's probably only so much you can do with this plot the 3rd time around, but then again I didn't expect much in the way of a story line. However even the action was lame and tired. No suspense, no tension, a few fancy digital effects, the obligatory pithy one-liners. A big disappointment.

Review title: Cameron less? It still can work.
Review_body: When I went to go watch Terminator 3, I didn't know what to expect. Is this some sort of money making scheme from Arnold since his last few movies where busts?, or was this film really going to be a great addition to the Terminator saga. The answer was both. Since most of the original forefathers weren't involved with the picture, the new fresh voices added a wonderful new adventure pack addition to the story. I understand you can't always get the same actors involved, and I'm glad that they added new characters to take their place. Keeping Linda and Eddie in the film would have felt like a T2 remake instead of a sequel.I truly enjoyed this movie, and I hope that they decide to continue with the saga, hopefully we don't have to wait another twelve years to see it though.

Review title: It was FANTASTIC and held true to the originals!
Review_body: I loved it!  I have seen T3 twice already and it hasn't even been out a week.  I thought it held true to the original movies and lacked nothing despite the change in makers.  The second time I saw it, I took my nine year old nephew.  He also loved it!It has plenty of action yet still a solid story line.  Nick Stahl and Clare Danes were spectacular.  You could really 'feel' for their characters.  I wanted to give "John Connor" a hug!  They both made me imagine what it must be like to go through this experience.When I see a sci-fi flick, it must be made in a way that I 'buy in' to it. Where my logic doesn't constantly take over and say 'that could never happen'.  This movie, like the previous Terminators is made so that I sit back and enjoy the movie and forget all the reality stuff.Terminator 3 also leaves plenty of room for a T4.  All I can say is, I HOPE they make a T4!  I want more!  My nephew agrees.

Terminator 3 deserves its place beside Terminator 1 and 2 as the great cinematic epic that it is.I entered T3 with zero expectations.  I left feeling relieved and overjoyed -- "they did it," was my only thought.  "They made the sequel I would have made."  And they really did.Whatever the critics say, know this: even James Cameron approves of Terminator 3.  It carries his vision forward perhaps as faithfully as he himself would have done.  There is the landmark humor, action, and, above all -- story.I have read complaints, from some critics, who seem to think T3 was meant to be a perpetually extended version of its predecessor, T2.  No.  T3 is in new hands; spawned entirely by new brains.  The ideas are fresh, and the scope? -- Extraordinary.It is perhaps the best Terminator movie yet.

I have to say that I was not expecting a great movie with T3 "Rise of the Machines".  I was biased, thinking James Cameron was necessary to make it a success, but I was wrong.  The Terminator Story has taken a life of its own! It has evolved from the simple story-line of a single terminator trying to kill Sarah Connor to Skynet trying to kill all human life.  It is huge and the potential is vast.  Arnold Schwarzenegger's presence on screen was incredible.  For 55 years old, he is in excellent shape.  I highly recommend this movie to folks like me who don't think any movie can top T1 and T2. This movie isn't meant to top it, just continue it, and it does that very well.

Review title: Excellent action movie that is a little unique, not as good as the first two
Review_body: This movie surprised me, especially with the change of director. I thought it would not be good. However, i feel they did the series justice. I found the comical parts to be entertaining though sometimes hurt the mood of the movie. The chase scenes,particularly the first one, were a little different and not as monotonous as they have become these days. I would recommend this movie to anyone looking for a good time and that loves the terminator like myself.

Review title: An OK movie on its own weight, but not enough weight to carry on the Terminator Franchise
Review_body: Previews didn't really wet my appetite to see this movie, but I just had to know what they did to continue the Terminator Franchise.  The film started off on the right track but quickly took a detour. It lacked the proper mood and style of the first two films had and definitely lacked the punch. Storylines seemed to be thrown together and loose ends were tied up with sloppy knots (if they were even tied up at all).  The acting in the film made up somewhat for the poor writing.  Arnold's lines may seem a bit corny these days, but he still kicks ass and you can't have a Terminator film without him. Nick Stahl did a decent job, but I wonder why they couldn't get Eddie Furlong. The Terminator X was kind of cool, but you can't beat the T1000 or Arnold's character in the first Terminator.  Claire Daines was a good addition to the movie.  Linda Hamilton's character is missed in this movie too.  All in all, if you like action with flat emotions behind it, it's not a bad movie.  But it was a horrible injustice to what its predecessors built.  The only intriguing event in the movie came with the ending scene. As good as it was, it was not good enough to save this film and continue the franchise.

Review title: ARNOLD is BACK!!! Hey, we knew he would be...he told us so
Review_body:
The film runs close to 2 hours but with the pace of the action and the interesting storyline I found the movie to be over so quickly.
You can tell right away that T-3 was directed by someone different than the previous two. There is a different style. This movie has great atmosphere and doesn't take itself too seriously. The characters poke fun at themselves which makes this movie seem very fresh even though it is a 3rd installment.After a long dry spell and some health issues, ARNOLD is BACK!!! He makes his entrance into the movie with a nude scene similar to the opening of the prvious two Terminator's. You'll probably think as I did..."Wow, he looks ripped for 55!!!" He has shrunken from his prime. You don't see much of Arnold's muscle after the first scene. He wears heavy black leather which can make one of those anorexic Tyra Banks model wannabe's look big. Most of Arnolds fight scenes are actually chasing scenes not requiring him to do much physical activity. Sure he is hanging from a crane be dragged through buildings but we all know that those are special effects...and not really him, let alone any other Mr. Universe.Said all this the movie is fresh, very entertaining and is the best of the big action movies so far!!! It does it's job and makes a case for a T-4. One question...if Arnold loves Hummer's so much why is he driving a Toyota Pick-up the whole movie? It would have been much more entertaining to see him ripping around the streets in one of those new Hummer H2's...GM could have brought out a special edition and call it an H3. You saw it in T3 now you can own your very own H3. Come on!!!

No more Cameron? No more Hamilton? No more T-1000? No problem guys, director J. Mostow and actionhero star Arnold Schwazzenegger, delivered the goods! The O.S.T. sounds great, the acting perform very well...the story and the CGI are amazing. Why twelve years from T2? Scwarzy reprise is old role that make him a superstar in a wonderful shape (Arnold turn 55 this year)I'm waiting for T4, I'm sure it will be an another installament of this epic sci-fi saga. AMAZING!!!!!

Let me start by saying that like many, I am a great fan of previous Terminator movies, and when I heard they are making a new Terminator I was very enthusiastic and imagined all the huge possibilities that movie could have.When I first saw that Terminator 3 is not directed nor written by James Cameron, my hopes came a bit down. When I saw that role of the evil terminator would be played by a model who has no acting experience I began to get the feeling how this movie would be. I tried to prepare myself for the failure for a long time. But nothing could prepare me for this... The movie was awful. I don't think I have ever been disappointed in any other movie this much.In T-3 they do everything I hoped they wouldn't do. They have added totally unnecessary humour in spots that it doesn't fit in at all. The script is terrible, and whole movie has no content. The movie totally lacks the dark and somewhat distressing feeling the previous Terminator movies had, especially the first one. When watching T-3 at some points I thought if they are serious about this movie at all. Kristanna Loken:s roleplay is plain annoying, every time she comes to screen she does something stupid... She has lines that a robot surely wouldn't say. Arnold Schwarzenegger is a bit better, but it's obvious that Cameron was the one who was keeping both the story and Arnolds roleplay together. Writers have tried to find new "legendary" comments but fail with an embarrassing way.Jonathan Mostow:s amateurish directingwork combined with low-class storywriters has made a sequel that totally ruins Terminator series and disrespects its great predecessors. All I can say is I hope I would have never seen this movie. If they do any more of these terrible sequels to get money by abusing the name, I will not watch them.

What an enjoyable experience - twelve years on and they succeeded in making a film that didn't ruin the story and at the same time delivers one hell of a fast-paced, monster of a movie. High Art it isn't, but the action is as good as it ever was and the warning against over-reliance on computers and machines is made again and made well. I came in with high expectations and wore a smile for the duration of T3. $10 to completely forget reality and lose oneself in cinema is money well spent. Most modern action movies fail to do that.

Review title: Why this movie left me(huge terminator fan) disappointed **most likely some spoiler or two**
Review_body:
Ok. I am a HUGE sci fi fan and I love Terminator and T2. I had huge hopes for T3 but it just left me feeling REALLY REALLY EMTY.1st. The movie felt like it was cut. It felt like it was heavily cut. The movie runs for about 104 mins.. T2 ran for well over 2 hours atleast.The dialogue was at zero. And I suspect alot of plot never really got explored, like when T-X is sent to kill Connors officers.. She kills 2. And thats that.Furthermore there is no suspense no nothing like that. Remember T2? We didnt even know who was the good / Bad Terminator until Well 25-30 mins into the movie. Here The Biggest scene in the whole movie with the crane chase is well underway after 25-30 mins. It just feels like they rushed everything. Do the movie companies really give us so little credit nowadays so they think we wont sit thru a film unless it has action ALWAYS??Now to my biggest concern which ties to the cutting.The movie is basicly just ACTION non stop ACTION. I know you will say ok well its a good action movie. Yes i agree But this is terminator.. they had 12!! years to come up with a INCREDIBLE script. What we get is a script that is nonstop action no dialogue no plot no nothing except mindnumbing action.I mean first its the fight at the veterinarian, then they drive for what? 5 mins then they fight at the cemetary, then they fight at the military complex then they go to the fallout shelter and the movie is basicly Done. There is so minimal dialogue (ok i know im repeating myself) that I could puke. This is a Terminator movie not a action movie they should have done more.
And now to the minor stuff.Whats the deal with all these stuff that makes no sense. Like when he puts on these silly glasses the male stripper had then he takes them off and crushes them. Ok hes a ROBOT, does he have some coolness program he must obey? If he has a directive to wear glasses he should have worn these it would have made complete sense.Then whats the deal with counting how many cops hes killed?? I hate how movies these days have aboslutely no balls. Like when Spielberg replaced the rifles in E.T with walkie talkies.. This terminator was Sent fro the future he had NO directive not to kill cops he repeats his directives More then once i think and its solely to ensure that connor and his wife lives.
This movie was made for the fast buck and it sucks because they destroyed possibly the greatest line of movies everThanks for the rantSue

Nothing much. Probably the worst movie of the year.  I was expecting a better story line . By now, we don't expect what kind of effect a movie present . But we consider ' how ' it is presented. T1 was heaps better than this one.

Review title: if you love T1 and T2, you will LOVE T3! Pure enjoyment!
Review_body: I was thoroughly pleased with this entire movie, from beginning to end. It's amazing to have 3 movies in a series that are all excellent. I was concerned when there was no James Cameron involved, (remember the terrible 'Alien 3' after the incredible "Aliens"...). But I did see Gale Anne Hurd's name in the producers. Kristanna is a really beautiful actress...I hope she makes many more movies!

Review title: Awful - a has-been hacking a ham-fisted money fest
Review_body: An appalling production with dreary direction and really ham-fisted acting. Arnies' looking and sounding very past it - way past retirement. The whole thing was just awful. It should not have happened. its has spoilt the previous two films.

Review title: Absolutely sensational! Bring on Terminator 4: The Resistance!
Review_body: Absolutely sensational! Johnathon Mostow took the reigns of the Terminator franchise and delivered the goods! Couldn't have asked for more! Great performance by Nick Stahl and Claire Danes especially, and as usual, Mr Schwarzenegger was awesome! Good debut for Kristanna Loken also! Bring on Terminator 4: The Resistance!

arnie sure has gotten old, hasn't he? in one way that's cool, but in another it just isn't, cause he doesn't look tough and evil anymore. i liked him very much in his last movie. and i have to say, that i like it. the way he is today he kinda looks cute, more teddybear like i mean. makes me kinda wanna kuddle with him... and that is almost the whole problem with terminator 3. he just isn't the terminator anymore, i think. he's cool with his sunglasses and his character has cool and funny lines in the movie like in the early ones, but it just isn't the same anymore. i also heard the stories about the film before i went to the cinema, that people told, like eddie furlong isn't doing the part of john anymore and it isn't a john cameron movie... and  stuff like that... but after i've seen it i realized that there are much bigger problems with the story and the whole invention of this movie: first thing is that even if i first thought i would miss edward furlong, i just wasn't nick stahl is cool, cause (like many people wrote before) he just IS the son of kyle reese... second comes the much bigger problem... the irresponsible decision of the writers, that sarah connor died of cancer... how much more obvious could you write a person out of the story, regardless what reasons there are, it's just ridiculous how they replaced one female counterpart of john with another, namely (although i liked the perfomance of claire danes quite much) third thing and for me the quite dissapointingst one is the lenght of the movie. i don't think that the movie would have been good under 125 minutes... the introduction of the characters and the story itself is good, but in absolutely no relation to the rest (the action- climax and showdownparts). i couldn't demand the length of the terminator 2 ultimate edition (although it wouldn't have been that bad) but at the end there isn't much story in this whole movie. i think it just isn't complex enough, and that is what i just can't understand... i mean james cameron can do dense, exciting and in no scene boring movies with much story and a length of almost 3h. and he did it a lot of times. (aliens, titanic, terminator 2) and i would think that he kinda thinks of terminator as one of the works of his lifetime, but why does he do such a thing with the terminator movies then? it's just sad... i liked the movie, but i think he just doesn't really like his terminator very much...

Review title: OH GREAT ITS A NEW TERMINATOR
Review_body: (SPOILER) T3 is amazingly pretty good, it has an ok story plot and ok acting, but what makes it really good is its special effects and sound. After T2 though you would have thought it was over and it had a happy ending hinting it was all over. Arnold has come back to protect John Connor from an even more powerful Terminator, which in my oppinion doesnt live up to the T-1000.  Yeah the T-X (Kristanna Loken) is amazing not to mention very attractive. The movie does have some errors from the whole story plot, but James Cameron didnt direct this one.  I felt this could have been better, but then again it shouldnt have been made.  T2 still in my mind remains the greatest Terminator movie ever and one of the best action films of all time.

I have nothing bad to say about this film, perhaps except for its music, a bit boring. But ignore this weakness, everything is perfect.T-X is really a dangerous and hot and beautiful killing machine. I am wondering why there are some saying that T-1000 (T2) was more dangerous than T-X. She is ,T-X, is faster.And T-1000 did not have any gun and he could not bend his shape like T-X can.One more thing and is the most dangerous thing about T-X is she can control and give orders to other machines.This is very obvious, even Terminator was under her control to fight against John Corner.So do you guys think this female machine is more dangerous ? In T2, there was only one bad guy (T-1000). In this time, there are lots of killing machines controled by T-X.There are lots of hot actions that worth to see.I am very impressed when the two ultimate machines fighting each other. And when they chasing each other on the roads.And I think the end is very good.It gives us some to think of such as we are killing ourselves by our weapons and machines....Every actor in this film , I think, has completly accomplished their roles.Congratulations Go Cameron, I am waiting for T4. I give this movie 9/10

Review title: I think this is the ruins of it all.
Review_body: As a big fan of the Terminator movies I was in awe of the possibility of a third installment.  Although the chance of wrecking those other two great movies was evident I was quietly hoping for another one.  As long as James Cameron, Arnold Schwarzeneger, Linda Hamilton and Edward Furlong were involved and they could explain how the machines have made a come-back decently I would be happy.  Two out of six just isn't good enough.Terminator 3: The Rise of the Machines is the biggest disappointment I think I'll ever have in my life.  Let's face it we all knew when James Cameron didn't sign up it was going in the wrong direction.  I just didn't realize HOW WRONG.  The appointment of Jonathan Mostow as director wasn't exactly showing the studio were moving hell and high water to give this movie any sort of chance.  Although I hear that the bigwigs cut Mr. Mostow's original T3 to shreds so maybe he isn't THAT bad.  Then we hear that Edward Furlong has been forgotten as John Connor because of drug problems.  Now I don't know about you but if I were in charge of a major franchise such as The Terminator, I would not change the face of the main character in the third movie.  It just cheapens the movie so much and when you go and hire Nick Stahl, a guy who looks nothing like Edward Furlong then your going the right way for a wrong Terminator sequel.  Maybe if the studio waited a few months and actually HELPED Edward out then this movie wouldn't be so fake to the real fans.  Most of you will know that Sarah Connor isn't in this movie. I don't want to spoil this big surprise that you have already worked out but I'll just say it's a storyline that I would be expecting from a Sons & Daughters TV soap episode, not a multi-million dollar budget action movie.Arnold Schwarzeneger makes his return as the terminator that we all love so dearly.  He enters in that chaotic fashion as in the first two films in the big disco-ball thingy.  Look at this scene and remember it as this is the last time you will have any sort of love for this movie.  Up comes the "I need your clothes" scene.  Humour they call it.  I can't describe the pain I felt while watching this bit...You'll have to experience it for yourself. Arnold isn't the same here.  In the other two movies he was believable and menacing.  His acting is truelly dire here and his character doesn't have any connections with the other's at all.  Where as in the second he was learning stuff and asking questions in this one he's just...there. Kristanna Loken.  She is a mobile phone with legs and a flamethrower compared to the T-1000 from Terminator 2.  Her part in the film makes no sense to me at all.  Skynet would not think that if the next assassin they send out had boobs it would have any sort of advantage.  No...the STUDIO thought that if they had a T-X with boobs they would pull in the male's who are guided by their "other organ" and maybe get a sponsorship deal with Kleenex Tissues when the DVD comes out.  The T-X isn't menacing, it isn't scary nor is it big or clever.  It's just...there.  For your viewing pleasure.  Please enjoy while I go throw up into a lucky-bag.Ah...John Connor.  Living "off the grid".  Now before this movie I was led to believe that he was trained ever since he was a small boy to be a huge commando leader type.  Instead we have a puny, moany, cry-baby wuss who I would be able to terminate with an elastic band and a paper-clip.  Nick Stahl isn't the same mould as Furlong.  He doesn't have that same street cred or charm.  He's just...there.  Now the storyline between him and Kate Brewster (Claire Danes) was pretty interesting but not enough to save this movie.  All Claire Danes did in this movie was scream and look horrified. It isn't asking much and well...she delivered.  Well done Claire!  You have just shown you are able to do the two most useful things a female can do in a male-dominated movie world.  Maybe you'll be in the next Scream sequel. *yawn*Now the special-effects were the main attraction of Terminator 2: Judgement Day.  I'm shure they will be passed off as the main attraction here as well. I just don't see why.  The fight scenes were just unbelievable...in a bad way, and the car chase scene although a good idea could have been filmed A LOT better.  To me it just isn't good enough.  You need a good director, good actors and a good script.  All three were atrocious here.  People who love this movie will hold the storyline and the apocalyptic ending (yeah you know how it ends) as their two shining good-points.  The storyline was pretty good but it sets itself up for a tire-some "I seen this coming a mile away!" ending that doesn't cut it.  People have been ending their movies on notes like this for so long I was shure it wouldn't be a surprise to anybody.  I haven't even mentioned the score being missing.  You would not believe how much this film misses it.  I was actually humming the tune to the start of the movie because it so obviously should have been there.Well to sum this movie up, I hated it with all my heart.  They ruined the first two classics and have the sheer audacity to set themselves up for a fourth.  Terminator fans will have to be given some sort of injection to let their grip be realised from the cinema-seats and the rest...well...they can just sit and enjoy their popcorn, the big explosions and the boobs like they are expected to.3/10

Me and a couple of friends went to watch this last night with pretty low expectations. As major fans of the first 2 movies (and all Arnie's late 80's - early 90's outings)we couldn't see how a 56 year old could convince as a killing machine, and with no James Cameron at the helm and a GIRL (?) as the main nemesis things were looking less than promising. However, I'm delighted to say that I obviously know less than nothing as this movie absolutely ruled. Nobody else could play the title role period. Arnies performance was fantastic, shifting from  brutal, urinal over the head violence to real laugh out loud comedy with some of the coolest one-liners in recent memory. Nick Stahl and Claire Danes did well in their roles and the director stepped up a gear with some awesome, realistic (ok not realistic, but not 100% CG ala Matrix Reloaded) action sequences. All in all a pretty near perfect summer action movie, roll on T4. Last word however is reserved for the T-X, not only was she well tasty, (damn that long curly hair, always gets in the way)but she gave a convincing performance and more than held her own next to Arnie. Roll on Kristanna Loken in Striptease 2 - Return of the Tease!

Review title: Action packed! But it lacked the Worldly omnipresent feeling......
Review_body: YES Arnold is still imposing at 55! Kristanna Loken is gorgeous! decent performances by the cast all around.. the movie lacked a scene which involved thousands of people dying fleeing etc. at least thats what i expected..... the bathroom fight scene was one of the best ever! Arnold was very funny! this movie was fun but doesn't compare to T2!

Review title: A classic continuation to a classic saga
Review_body: This movie is really awesome. It's just that simple. Within the first 10 seconds of the film, I was totally hooked. I kept my eyes on the screen at all times.There is a ton of action, and a few very funny moments, but really, it doesn't take anything away from the very emotional and powerful story. This film is great.A few people seem to think that this film isn't as good as the others...I totally disagree. Give this film a few years, and it will become a classic, like the previous movies. T-2 took years to become a classic. Many people thought at first that it ruined the saga because it was the first time you saw the Terminator as a "babysitter"...However, as the years went by, it became in many people's minds a classic. Give T-3 a few years, and it will become a classic too. It's an excellent film with strong messages and a strong story.10/10

First of all, i´d like to say that I really love the whole history, I think that was the best science fiction history ever. But I have to say that I didn´t understand much it..the movie for me fails in many things, such as:..Jonh Connor should ´ve been edward furlong, , nick stahl was ridiculous(not him, but he wasn´t fit properly for the role and I don´t like changing actors in sequels for same role)...The movie let us many questions and I would like to somebody answer it:..What happened to the laboratory exploded in T2:..WHAT is the connection between Miles Dyson and the father of Claire?..for me, the way that the history is told in T3 sounds like one neverending story, every time that one terminator is sent to the past it is terminated and: should not the future be changed?...this is for me the message in T2, that the 3 chips were destroyed...the only reason for me to keep terminators being sent to the past is if we are dealing to many dimensions or parallel Worlds...now we have a situation:finaly, Judgment day is arrived..Could have enough space for T4?..I think that is the only reason to save the trilogy...happening in the future(now present)..the machines X humans....humans winning...so, the machines build the ultimate killer machine...a TERMINATOR made by light( i heard that this terminator would be the TX)..this Terminator tries to kill Jonh in the future, but for some reason it fails...so, it is sent to the "many pasts" to bring back all terminators (T1000, TX)...together with it, all these 3 terminators went back to 1984, to kill Sarah( they have, now all informations about her)...it´s up to jonh, arnie and clarie to go back and try to stop them.....what do you guys think...for T3 I give 3 stars in 5

Any sequel needs a new, fresh, approach to either the story or its characters. Preferably both, of course... T3 lacks this, and is actually nothing more than a transportation to T4. Frankly, I was rather bored. Giving the TX a female gender is not a twist, actually it is hardly even variation, it is just boring. If anything, it is evidence that this Venus/Mars myth, which prevails in our society, is pure nonsense. (In case You had not found that out yet...) T4 has got the prerequisites of becoming another great movie, while T3 is but a story that has to be told in order to get a good basis for T4. This is unfortunate, but perhaps inevitable? Another thing that bothers me is Arnie's apparent personal influence on his own character, i.e. in the script. His ambiguity at the end of the movie messes up the ice cold logic of the plot, inherited from T1 and T2, which is a shame. Once re-programmed, he should act in accordance to that, without remorse. Personally, I would wish that Arnie's character was reduced to a minimum in the sequel(s) to come. The (great) overall story would gain tremendously from that.

Review title: It's a good cheap thrills comedy but no TERMINATOR film...
Review_body:
T3: I  knew it would be bad, I had heard what James Cameron thought about it so I was sort of prepared for a couple of hours of utter nonsense.To sum it up this film just feels cheap the whole way through. I don't mean the budget (which I am sure was 10 times the first one) but the acting the story the... well the whole film. If you were to remove the action scenes (which just didn't have the same richness as with James Cameron's in T1 and T2) you were left with a basis for a good film.There were some nice ideas, it's just a shame they left the idea of possibly making an interesting, intelligent classic masterpiece like the first two and went instead for the big action scenes to please the masses...As a Terminator film T3 sucked. It was appalling and I have no wish to ever see it again thank you very much.To try and be at all positive, if you ignored the fact that this film has ruined a potentially awesome trilogy (eg: ALIEN ALIENS ALIEN 3 not inc Resurrection) and look at it as a comedy it's not that bad. There are some quite amusing parts from Arnie. But like I said, it's not a touch on the first two and I don't want to see it again.Someone else on here mentioned the fourth film  may be better but I think it's best to put it to rest. Some things are best left alone.
We have found out that no one but James Cameron can do it, unless he is allowed to make his own version T3 lets save us any further embarrassment and bury the Terminator before it's too late.It is my fondest wish that Arnie wont be back...Thanks.Monty.

It's unfortunate that movie opens with an intro that doesn't make much sence. Sure you get some information about judgement day as we all know it's what this movie is about. But after there short intro, you just get thrown into some action scenes with arnold vs Kristanna. And the story is left open for the second part of the movie. A very unfortunate factor according to me as I was sitting there waiting for the story while they were trashing vehicles and blowing up s***.However terminator three makes a good story after and the plot is nice. But try to tell the story of the movie to a friend. For some movies you can talk an hour. You need minute maximum to explain everything with this one. That's why I didn't really like the movie.Terminator is still one of the classics and excellent to see with a nice bag of popcorn.One thing is for sure... Arnold will be back, cause the movie just screams for another sequel. (If that'll be with arnold again as governors don't get too much time to act i guess ;) ).

Review title: The one sequel too many - Spoilers
Review_body: I think there is an unwritten law about Hollywood that goes somewhat like: "There can be only one good sequel." On most occations sequels rarely surpass the original and I have to say my expectations were pretty high for a second sequel like T3 when I heard about it. After all Cameron has managed to make some fairly good sequels. Then I found out Cameron was not on the job. My expectations dropped. Not that I'm a Cameron fanatic, don't get me wrong - it's just that I had never even heard of Mostow before. Well let's make a long story short: I went to the movies and was at first pretty satisfied with the film. First impression good. However, the more I started analyzing it, the less I liked it. The plot was really just taken directly out of T2 and modified in a way to make it seem like new. Nothing new here, except this time the villain is in female form - that and John is older. By the time we get to the action (not too long) I started noticing how the pace of the movie has ruined it. The makers clearly thought that if there is enough action people forget about the plot holes. They had the inevitable car crashing bashing scene (please, haven't we seen enough of these already, they're in -every- action flick today!) and our heroes were so busy running around they didn't even have time to go over the situation. Character development: totally unbelievable (can't say more, I'd be spoiling). They couldn't make the story hold anymore, and what's worse it's still left open for a fourth episode. The only part about this movie that I really enjoyed was Arnold. He is the sole reason to see the movie. His one-liners and cheesy accent are still worth a couple of laughs. And he does have a few new ones too. All in all, the movie was ok, but that's just it. It wasn't great like it's predecessors. And I'm not going to say Cameron could have saved it, but I'm saying maybe Cameron had a reason for dumping the project. Compared to some other action movies today T3 is actually quite descent, but it doesn't even nearly live up to the greatness of T2 or the freshness of T1. If all you care for is action though, you could do a lot worse. grade: C

After seeing T2 on video, complete with directors cuts, I though T2 was the best movie I'd ever seen in my life. Emotion mixed with action, complete with plot and believeable characters. Great! So I was all hyped up when T3 came out, and went to see it at the first showing in my cinema... I came out thinking why was that so good? Where did the $185m budget all go? It was all just blowing stuff up. Even the T-x was a disappointment- she just didn't seem that much more advanced (compared to the T-1000). And John... the way he acted just didn't seem like John! He wasn't the way I thought he'd be... Basically, I thought T3 was pretty rubbish, and to me it was a big disappointment. The storyline was... well, nonexistant, the dialogue (especially from the T-800) sounded forced and like they were just going for the jokes. Terminator is not a comedy, so don't try and make it one! Any humour that should be in it comes naturally. And that's about all I have to say...

Brilliant, really brilliant. I love this movie exactly as I loved T1 and T2. Arnie is still Arnie :) and I think, if there's a fourth part it should be with him again. I have just one little note - too much humor. Why he had to put these stupid star-glaces?? Why saying "I'll Be Back" and "She'll be Back". Just a few moments that made me a little nervous. The pressure from the first and the second part wasn't so great here because of these comedy elements. But everything else is just perfect and I'm saying to everybody - Watch this film... it really deserves your money.P.S. Nick Stahl is brilliant - made his role the bast way possible.

Lacks the punch of originality, but T3 does not disappoint. T3 delivers awesome action with a solid story line. Fits together nicely with the previous films, and finishes with a great set-up for the post Judgement Day generation of Terminators.

Definetly as crap as ridiculous though I a fan of the first and second episodes. They should broadcast it directly on cable TV or sell in VHS at lower price. I'm a big fan of Arnie even if he's far from Actor's Studio, but T3 is his worst role. Forget this movie and watch T1 again.

this is the best movie i have seen this summer.i am a very big Terminator fan and i think the casting was excellent i dont think there would be a better TX and Arnold was the best pick.I am so sad that they both got terminated though.i was like "what the..."when it happened.but still i think this was a really good movie and i cannot wait to get it on DVD.and for ppl who dont want to pay cuz their cheap asses u can download it off kazaa.i dloaded after i saw it in theatres and i was amazed it actually worked.In conclusion i think this was the best out of all 3 and i really recomend for u ppl to watch it
Peace Out LOL

Well you have to know going into watching this movie that it's not Cameron's anymore...I think the biggest mistake was going through with this without him.  Mostow has allowed my faith in him to decline rapidly.  The biggest mistake of the film is writing off Linda Hamilton and picking up Claire Daines in her place.  The thing that is different about this movie from the others is that the others were believeable to a degree.  This one just sucked.  It goes back and John is yet again in denial that machines exist...hello you saw one a few years back.  It basically all plays out too movie-ish....it could have been better and the whole idea of changing there is no fate..to there is fate and you can't do a thing about it was really dumb.  NO FATE...come on J. Mostow....did you even watch the other movies???? Note in making sequels you have to follow the rules...we don't want a completly sucky movie as part of the series...all in all it was ok...too much was changed but it was a good movie ne way....btw...I never once feared that TX would catch them...a woman terminator just wasnt' scary enough for me.

After 12 years, i was surprised that a 3rd Terminator movie was actually being made. The Terminator is the classic among action movies. Terminator 2:Judgment Day really stood the test of time to this day, and I believe that it surpassed the original, with a more in-depth storyline and characters, as well as a great performance by Robert Patrick as the liquid metal terminator. Terminator 3:Rise of the Machines takes the series to a whole new level. it has a lot more in common with T2 than #1. in my opinion, i think it was the most enjoyable of the 3. Arnold Schwarzenegger was perfectly natural at the role of the Terminator as always. Nick Stahl did a good job as John Connor. Claire Danes did a pretty good job introducing Kate Brewster. and it was good to see Earl Boen, who is the only actor besides Arnold to be in all 3 of the films, make an appearance once again as Dr. Silberman. but the one who really left a huge impression in my mind was Kristanna Loken as the T-X. i think her performance is amazing and her character outdoes that of the one from T2 played by Robert Patrick. she should at least get an Oscar nominee for that performance. she's an excellent actress, and i hope to see more of her soon. the movie also had some great action sequences, including the unforgettable one in the cemetery. it's definitely one of the best and most unique action sequences i've ever seen, and i've watched countless action movies, from the low-budget, video-only ones to the smash hits at the box office. i bought the DVD yesterday and it was very interesting to listen to the commentary by Schwarzenegger, Kristanna Loken, and the others. Terminator 3 was definitely a lot better than any other movie i've seen this year, and better than most i've seen in the past several years. it had a good ending that left hinting at another sequel. hopefully Arnold will be back for the main role if a 4th one is ever made, it just wouldn't be the same without him. also, it would be great if they brought back Kristanna Loken to play another female Terminator-she's perfect for the role.

I am a hard core Teminator fan...and I was very upset seeing this movie. It didn't fall into line with the other two. And if the terminator was different why at the beginning did he look under the viser(in Terminator 2 John Conner told him about looking under the viser) so I just wanted to note this- Don't make a trigiloy if you can't follow the story line!!!

T3 is so bad that it completely tarnishes the entire series.  Why they find it necessary to go the comical route is beyond me.  If any of the lame jokes that found their way into the movie were actually funny then maybe it wouldn't have been so bad but "talk to the hand?"  Give me a break.  That whole morality issue they tried to impart on the terminator this time was incredibly funny though.  Unfortunately it wasn't meant to be.  And why did they send back a wrinkly, less muscular terminator this time?  Because Arnold has entered the washed up era of his career and thought that throwing together a 3rd installment for his most popular work would re-ignite his career.  It's so sad when good stars go bad.

Let me first start by saying, Thank god this movie did not ruin the Terminator saga. For years I've been waiting for this film to arrive, and ever since it was first announced I never had negative thoughts on this movie. After those 3 years of waiting, I must say that I'm impressed by Mostows final product. No, it's not a Masterpiece like James Cameron's first two installments, buts its a worthy sequel. Alot of people have complained that there are too many plot holes, but there are no fewer plot holes than that of its 2 predecessors. The screenwriters and Mostow handled the continuation of T2 well. Don't get me wrong, this movie has its flaws, and YES James Camerons touch is missing, but does that make it a bad movie? No. 12 years is a long time to make a sequel, and based off of how poor some sequels are, I'm glad this one ended up a winner, box-office wise and critic wise. So on that note, congrats Arnold, Nick, Kristana, Clair etc...We now have another worthy entry into the collection of Sci-Fi trilogies. Hell, even bring on a Terminator 4.Rating: 7.5/10

Review title: Sleep until the end - it's the only decent bit
Review_body: this film has a rating of 7 stars as i write this review. it is my duty to contribute toward lowering this rating as it is misleading and suggests terminator 3 has some worth as a feature film and was deserving of the immense budget it received.basically, bar the end 'twist' it is dross, the new terminator is a waste of time and not nearly as menacing as the t1000 of mr Patrick in T2. weapons? plasma? my god, what nonsense... i know, let's make the terminator female and naked - that'll surely guarantee it's a hit.fair enough, she is hot, but the film is not. dismal and a waste of time and money - everybody's.

This film is a terrible letdown for what were an incredible first two films. It has used a name "Terminator" to make millions on a story that realistically is not worth the paper its written on. Im surprised that Arnold would even attach his name to this film, but undoubtedly a six figure number probably helped. It is rubbish. Poor acting coupled with a poor script leads to disastrous affects! as we clearly see in this movie. The fact that we have a woman terminator making mince meat out of Arnold (the figure) that James Cameron spent so much time making a legend of in the first to films. Instead of being the man of steal that we admired in the first two films Arnold is now more like a cross between Ricky Gervais and Vinnie Jones. Shame on whoever developed this film for letting an amateur (Jonathan Mostow) take the steering wheel of something that has over the years earned massive recognition only to smash it with what was to be known as Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines. POOR.

I think the movie was great over all but I thought it was kind of weird that t-x was a girl but it was still interesting.I think the movie should have been rated pg-13 instead of R because they didn't have that much blood and they only said F*ck like twice.I think my favorite scene in the movie was when the Terminator came out of the tomb with the coffin which contained John Conner and blew the police away with a .30 cal machinegun that was pretty awesome.What i also thought was funny was when t-x crashed into the base with a helicopter and was about to kill John Conner but then the Terminator crashed into t-x with a bigger helicopter.So for that I think it deserves at least an 8.

Review title: Take it for what it is
Review_body: I have come across quite a few people who disliked this movie. Their reasons are numerous: plot holes, it destroys the continuity, etc. I could go on and on but I will not do that here.I think the biggest problem that most people had going into this film was that they were expecting it to be something that it wasn't. They were expecting this movie to be another Terminator 2: Judgment Day. This movie, I believe, was never meant to be that. It did have likenesses to the other movies such as action sequences, time travel, etc. However, this movie needs to be judged on its' own merits and not that of the two movies preceding it, to do this is about as intelligent as judging a child against the performance of his/her siblings.I think that all parties involved in the making of this film did an excellent job in making a film that held up rather well. A good job was done of creating something that added to the Terminator storyline but still was original enough to be a good movie in its own right. Some familiar concepts in the Terminator Universe were taken and expanded on or better defined. It seems that most of the problems that I have heard from others who have viewed the film have come from their own preconceived ideas about what certain aspects of the film or Terminator Universe should be and not from the film itself.Therefore my recommendation about this movie is to simply take the film for what it is, entertainment. This is a good phrase to sum up what I think. As entertainment this movie holds up rather well. Take it for what it is and enjoy it. Don't beat your brain out trying to understand it because it is only a movie. Overall I think this was a good movie 7/10

T2 was just a snotty family movie, but you must admit it was a high-quality snotty family movie. If somebody wanted to defile everything with a gloomy hopeless secondary concocted thing (and nobody had any doubt that it would be a gloomy hopeless secondary concocted thing), they could at least try and make a high-quality one. And what did we see? We are absolutely lost in time-travel and alternative universes. That's very good. If we were not lost, we would clearly see how stupid all this stuff is. I will kill you in the future, because you will trust me after the story that was in the second film. All right. I'd like to see how he trusted him after he had told him (in the third film) that he would kill him. Or was it in one more alternative universe? Naturally, it was, in that universe all these young people had not been killed. And what will he do without them? Down with them, it's his problem, there's no fate, but he is doomed to save the humanity, so don't be afraid, he will save it! Schwarzenegger. We all know, that all his heroes are in fact one and the same hero, and he has only two ways in this situation: self-parody and self-plagiarism, and while the first is fun, the second is annoying. Now we see that he invited the third way: plagiarizing parody. Who needed it? Not me. It was just another way to make a connection with T2, and it didn't work, because it is a different film in a different era. Then, it is just badly done. Yes, they crashed much more cars, but why the chases in the first two films are as much more thrilling as less cars were broken there? They could just have rolled all those cars off a cliff without shooting it - with the same use, maybe, even with more use, because they would at least have had fun themselves. So many details that don't fit each other, the first two films and the reality, that it would be an even longer post if I tried to recall all of them. I still hope some of them are just a problem of the translation, but the other cannot be. Why such crude work? You probably remember that moment it T2, where a song begins with a new scene, "Bad to the bones" or something like that. What we find in this film? Another song, switched on in a somehow similar frame. But that one was as organic as a fragment of a song in the middle of a movie can be, and this one just strikes eardrums with no sense. All this "primary weapons", broken lavatory pans, fragile flying machines, mysterious blinking stands... It resembles a cheesy shooter video game much more than a film. Maybe, it was their primary target: to make a film easily transforming into a video game. But I am not going to play this game, neither I want to see the film many times.

Review title: T3: A systematic breakdown on why this film sucks from a Terminator FAN
Review_body: Reasons why this film is crap...1. The Terminator (Arnold) is a T-101 in Terminator 3...(bashes Mr. Mostow in the skull) NO! NO! NO! In T1 & T2, the Terminator is a T-800: Cyberdyne Systems MODEL 101. If you can't get the BASIC facts straight, you shouldn't assume the helm of any major and beloved franchise! 2. Linda Hamilton (Sarah Connor) turned down an initial version of the script because T3 portrayed Sarah Connor as a weaker character while maintaining the "weak" John Connor.3. Make way for Katherine Brewster, John Connor's "Sarah-Connor-wanna-be" wife, who saves his ass constantly. Yes, saves John Connor, the future military leader! The character, John Connor, is completely subdued in T3.4. The gay stripper at the male strip club with the star sunglasses? No! The whole reason the Terminator ever started wearing sunglasses is in T1 when he had to disguise his face after his eye cover was damaged and he couldn't "blend in" with society. In T2, the sunglasses weren't necessary either, but the Terminator didn't have the glasses on for much of the movie. Talk to the hand? Completely unnecessary and an ancient phrase at that! 5. "She'll be back?" Stop with the catch phrases of "...be back." 6. The premise of the Terminators in the past is to blend in with society while hunting and killing their prey. The T-X is a "down grade" from the T-1000 in T2. She has weaponry built in (doesn't fit in at a dinner party) and an endoskeleton under liquid metal. One aspect made known in T2 was the fact that the T-800 endoskeleton could be harmed and wear-out opposed to the T-1000 which was pure liquid metal, no skeleton to be beaten. The T-1000 could take tons of Damage and no sign of being harmed.There are a few more reasons. I know people will attack this post, but I am fundamentally correct in my statements. Audiences crave seeing films like T3: Rise of the Machines and Superman Returns even though they are pretty much, but not completely, crap because people just want to see Superman fly again or see the Terminator back in action! Damn the good characters and the good story lines that made people love the original films to start with. The more things change...the worse they get!

The day before its opening in theaters, I was just so excited. Terminator 3 who could believe it, it was amazing, could it be even better then Terminator 2? The answer was, NO!! What a disappointment, I felt like sh*t after the movie finished. What did they do to it!! Terminator was no longer the serious and heroic character, he was a stupid clown in screen! They messed it up. The movie s*cked not a little, but just a lot! Great special effects indeed but almost all day light scenes, comic and stupid look for terminator, lost characters, no emotion, no intensity, no fear, nothing. All the great master piece created by James Cameron in Terminator 1&2 was lost! I'm sorry to say but if you have not seen the movie and loved the first 2, don't watch it, trust me! This movie was made with one thing in mind, MONEY. They did not care about the story, the thriller or the characters. Just the money. NO wonder Cameron did not direct the third part, he wrote the story for and to finish in 2 movies, they just wrote on top to do the third one!Terminator 3, is not just the worst of all the terminators but a waste of time to watch. Other low budget action flicks, including Terminator 1 itself do 10 times better than this. I just hope that they do not go for Terminator 4, I would not take the risk to see it. Terminator 3 is just "rubbish" to see. I give it a 4/10 because of the special effects and Arnold, its not his fault after all!

Review title: the fall of the great terminator
Review_body: When i finally got the chance to see it, I was really disappointed. It felt like i was watching Godzilla VS King Kong, starts with action and doesn't stop right till the end of the movie. There was just one non-action scene as far as i can remember. I was expecting at least some more info about the rise of the machines and possibly time travel, so we have something new to taste... but nooo... some things i liked though, maybe the way how arnie came back in the game, the terminator woman did a great job of acting, but the movie couldn't provide the atmosphere of the previous two.If you like action popcorn movies with really expensive effects, go for it... otherwise, rather go see the second or the first in the series again...

Fanatic fans of the 2 previous Terminators may be disappointed, but I think there are no big reasons to be. We need to overlook some logical mistakes, and then we have here a good film and blockbuster for summer night. There are many actions such as scene with the fire department-car, these are one of the main parts of the film. The plot-line is only support for the show. Regarding actors, Nick Stahl, Claire Danes are average, Arnie plays his standard (like the old times :) and Kristanna Loken as marvelous T-X didn't need some special acting, she did empty face good :). So if you don't have big demands, you will not be disappointed..BTW Kristanna Loken is very cute :)

Review title: A Good Movie, yet A Flawed Story
Review_body: When I first heard of Terminator 3, I must say that I was surprised. Didn't the second one sum everything up nicely? I went to see the film with a large amount of doubt and misgivings. However, I was surprised. The acting was pretty decent (except for Claire Danes, ugh) and Nick Stahl does a decent job of portraying John Connor. The Terminatrix is sleek and powerful, and the creativity behind this machine is very well thought out. However, there is a major hole in this story. One of the beginning lines is this: John Connor says that "when I was 13, another Terminator was sent to kill me as a teenager. I was protected by a Terminator." However this cannot be true because of the simple fact that in T1, it begins in May 1984 (dialogue between Reese and the cop says so) so therefore Sarah could not have given birth to John until 1985. In fact in T2, when Robert Patricks liquid terminator character looks John up in the police computer, it says John birthday is 2/10/85. So, when John was 13 that would make the year 1998. Wait just a minute though. Judgement Day, according to Arnold's character, occurs on August 27, 1997. Whoa, talk about not thinking through the entire story before you write it! Holy snap! Also, in T3, Sarah Connor dies in 1997. Believable, only except for the fact that John says in T3 that Sarah battled Leukeimia for 3 years after the doc gave her 6 months to live. So, if the T3 storyline is true, Sarah died when John was 16! In 2001! But she couldn't have died then because in T2 Judgement day was supposed to happen August 27, 1997. Yes, I know they stopped it and all that, but apparently, the writers in T3 had that happen in 1998. So apparently the writers could have done a lot better job. In fact, another thing is John is supposed to be 23 in this movie. That would make the year 2008. So if John was born in 1985 (according to information given in T1 and T2) that would make the information (age-wise) accurate. So why the heck couldn't they make everything else accurate? Let's just hope that for T4 (which is in production) that they think the script through a little bit better, and try to keep it true to the story that James Cameron developed. Let's face it, his was a lot better.The SFX were incredible, especially the high speed chase scene about half an hour in. The story (except for the flaws mentioned above) was touching and remarkably well done. I loved the ending scene, where you see the nuclear warheads falling at various locations around the world. Overall this was not a terrible movie. I don't think it held up to the first two, but it is a good continuation. My Rating: **1/2 out of ****

Sometime in 2006 i discovered this film funny actually before the others and i loved well back then t3 was my favorite film and i watched it at least 20 times in my high school years.Thinking back now it wasn't a bad film a good action flick with shootouts explosions neighborhood vehicle battles, just fun action! I think the thing got me to so enjoy it was the robots/terminators they're so cool and definitely the nude one (T-X. Kristanna Loken) haha.So i finish by saying the first 2 were amazing and had a more gripping story lines but T3 introducing me to Terminator deserves a look at!7.3 1/2 out of 10

Review title: why did you make this movie?
Review_body: Once upon a time there was a movie called " Terminator 2: Judgement Day " and it was watchable nice movie. Then the makers of that movie didn't think that the money they earned from this movie wasn't enough and you know what kind of a money I am talking about...
