Then they made this following movie " Terminator 3: The Rise of The Machines " and they made the 2. movie loose its good appearance on people' s minds. I only vote this movie 4 points because the special effects are very good. But the scenario is really awful... And I also protest Arnold Schwarzenegger by not watching his movies anymore because of supporting a holocaust which DOES NOT EXIST. I think he should read more history books instead of spending time on body building, before starting to support an idea like that.

Review title: T2 should have been where the story ended...
Review_body: I loved the first 2 films and I was very excited about the possibility of a T3. After T2 I figureed things were over. When I heard the rumors of a T3, I wondered how it could be possible after the way T2 ended. Was there another chip, was there something left at the metal plant, etc. I was curious to see why. So I was understandably shaken when the premise for the whole film was summed up in 1 line. I felt like getting up and walking out at that point. There was no real tension, not much terror and how scary is it to have a supermodel chase around a dude, his future wife and a robot? . I think the franchise should have ended after T2 and this was an obvious attempt for Arnold to get 1 last great payday before going into politics full time.

Many action scenes, sticky phrases, explosions, robot fighting, muscle, humor, drama, hot girl, etc. The classic Schwarzenegger action movie! The new terminator "TX" its a cold beautiful woman, and Arnold looks exactly the same as 10 years ago, that would stun you for sure. The DVD i have (region 4 South America, Australia)has the greatest extras I've ever seen, the menus, Skynet database, Terminator timeline, make your own special FXs, preview of Mc Farlanes toys, hilarious scenes, how special FXs where made, etc. It also has very interesting comments in movie by the director an the actors and its translated in many languages, the Spanish voice acting its great, the voices are very similar to the real actors. A must have for any Terminator fan!

Review title: Not true to the original creator's vision
Review_body: Okay this movie really disregards the previous ones in the series. Terminator 1 & 2 basically said Judgement Day could be prevented whereas this movie basically says it could only be postponed. So what was the point of the first two movies of doing all that fighting against the terminators if it would only lead to Judgement Day getting postponed?Lines of dialogue where really cheesy, I mean the terminator says to a convenience store clerk who confronts him for shoplifting, "Talk to the hand." Seriously. The film also felt like it was directed by Michael Bay rather than Johnathan Mostow due to all the freaking explosions and other excessive destructive special effects. Yeah I know there's going to be destruction inherently because that's what the war of machines is about but to have all this repetitive focus on it makes it annoying and boring rather than cool and emotion grabbing.I felt John Conner and Kate Brewster were rather lame characters in this movie, I mean I just didn't feel the awesomeness that they were supposed to portray. So in conclusion, the plot, characters, and dialogue of the movie SUCKED and didn't hold true to the previous movies. The music, effects were about the only thing that were good.

Review title: Another sequel screwing up the first 2....
Review_body: When I first heard they were making Terminator 3 I shook my head in disgust. T2 is my favorite movie of all time and to top it would be impossible, not because Cameron is this all-mighty director, although he is very good, but that the movie was just done too well in T2. From the directing, acting, plot, the score, everything. T3 has none of these traits and that's what makes it a garbage movie.I hate how Hollywood lets movies like this be created and ruin the image behind the first two completely. Just like the Alien movies, the first two were ruined by the memories of the last two. It's too bad that directors would rather make money than let people remember what the good movies stood for. On to crap 3. T3- First off, where is the music? The theme that the die-hard Terminator fans have known to love wasn't until the ending credits. Not that that makes a movie but I was looking forward to hearing it in the beginning. Not only that but there was a no music until about half-way in the movie it seemed like. It was just quiet and lame.The beginning scene was total ridiculous. He goes into the male strip bar only to say talk to the hand and NOW! to his hand. It was so lame and a complete rip-off of the T2 bar scene.The movie also have a very rush feeling to it to me. There was no character development what-so-ever. The love story didn't flow at all. Her fiancé is killed and she really didn't show any remorse or sadness that he was dead for more than a few seconds. When the Terminators first come together and the truck bounces over the girl I think I laughed out loud at how stupid that was. Not only that but the TX wasn't even scary to me and seemed less advanced than the T-1000. Robert Patrick was far more freaky as the creepy T-1000 than that girl ever was. Also, the T-1000 really couldn't be damaged. You could slow him down by freezing him or shooting but he always came back together because he was liquid. The TX was still metal underneath and could be damaged, which didn't seem more advanced to me. They couldn't come up with a better idea than the T-1000 though so they create this crap of combining the two Terminators into one. Retarded.The humor in the movie was terrible and really took away from the Terminator feel in my opinion. The Terminator is supposed to be a killing machine, ruthless, relentless, careless. But this Terminator was cracking jokes and not really hurting anyone. In T2 it made sense but only because John was teaching him not to hurt people, and he still did. Also, when the Terminator was carrying the coffin and shooting at the police why didn't he kill anyone? Again, this made no sense because John didn't teach him not to do this so why didn't he kill anyone? I can't comprehend how people like this crap.I think a major clue that the movie was going to suck before even seeing it was that it was rated PG-13. Any movie called "Terminator" should automatically be rated R. The other movies were more violent whereas this Terminator was a damn kids movie. Since when were Terminator movies supposed to be funny? What are they having the Terminator cracking jokes? In the second movie it made more sense because John was teaching the Terminator human speech. In this one he was just throwing out lines with no one teaching him anything. I wanted to throw a knife at the screen this movie was so bad.One thing that I didn't get is that all of a sudden in this Terminator film he can crash through pretty much any wall, smash marble, get beaten to a pulp and he is fine, not to mention put his head back on after it was knocked off which makes no sense, and fight his programming. The film was complete garbage and frankly I'm shocked that as many people liked it as I see on this board. I read people said he was a different model from the other Terminators, but when did they ever explain that in T3? Makes no sense.I have a theory that most people enjoy crap movies with no plot and just mindless action. Sadly, this is true because people would rather be entertained than have to think and this is a prime examples of that. Just like many people liked the trashy movie Independece Day because it "kept your attention", the same people like T3 because of the lame car chase, or the fight scene between the TX and the Terminator.I watched the making of T2 and Cameron had first written the script to have T2 as the final Terminator. The beginning scenes were actually Conner and team taking over Skynet and destroying it and finding unused 101's, and that's when he sent it back in time. However, that was cut due to run time of the movie. I for one am going to pretend T3 does not exist and that they did in fact stop the war in T2 because I can's stand the idea of T3. I wish I could go back in time and stop this movie from being created. I give it -10 out of 10. Utter garbage.

It is a good movie because it is interesting. I like it because of the advanced technology used in the movie, I have watched it a lot of times. Some people say it is a bad movie, but my opinion is that it is a great movie. The bad thing is that I find it boring sometimes, probably because I watched it a lot. I also really like the Terminator T- X. I really recommend that movie. It is in my list of favorite movies. I also think that it is some of the best Terminator movies. I try to never miss it on TV. I enjoy watching it with my friends and family. The first time I watched it was in late 2003, shortly after it was released. I cannot really describe it.

While overall I enjoyed the movie the ending just does not work . in the first two movies the plot was such that "skynet" as housed in a supercomputer that becomes self aware. then nukes the world.in this installment however "skynet" is the internet, IE. it is nothing more then a virus that takes over all the small home computers connected to the internet and becomes self aware, OK this could work. but then to make amends with the previous movies, it still nukes everyone ! the problem is all those locations and computers are skynet itself, in effect skynet would be destroying its own brain in an attempt to destroy the humans. so the the question becomes why would skynet destroys 99% of itself ? it wouldn't.

I was really looking forward to the prospect of a third instalment to the Terminator series, but when i read that it was to be a 12A rating, i was outraged. There's no need for it, is there. If you look at the 3rd movie it tells you all. It has an edgy and out of touch storyline. It's not directed by James Cameron, it was left for 12 years to be revisited, it has no Linda Hamilton, no Edward Furlong(they left it to late for him, not seeing the inevitable, that he would end up in rehab)and the main attraction and the only attraction is a 56 year old Terminator who is on the verge of bowing out of the industry(Arnie). These are not the things that frustrate me in a big way, i'll tell you what it is, it's the films disgraceful attention to detail: 1) Nick Stahl(John Connor) says that the Terminator visited him first when he was 13, when anyone who actually watched T2 will know that John was 10 in the 1995 based Terminator 2, and he would have had to have been 10 because his mother, Sarah fell pregnant with him in late 1984(shown in Terminator). 2) It says on Sarah Connors coffin that she was born in 1959 and died in 1997 from leukaemia. She wasn't born in 1959, she was 19 in 1984, that was explained in T2, she had to be born in 1964 or 1965. 3) John says in T3 that his mother contracted Lukemia in 1994, and died from it shortly after the predicted Judgement Day. Now if that's the case why wasn't this mentioned in 1995 based T2, well i'll tell you why, they didn't expect Linda Hamilton to turn down the 3rd movie role, so they created some bull crap story to cover up her disappearance. I didn't reckon much of Nick Stahl's dry performance and i think that Director Jonathan Mostow & writers John Branicato, Michael Ferris & Tedi Sarafian should give each other some hard slaps and be cast out of the movie making industry for ruining a franchise by making the third instalment having never watched the first two movies. They just wanted to make money, they don't care about those hardcore fans, they don't love films, they mock the industry. 12A gets the kids in, gets the money in, takes the brilliance out. CAMERON WE NEED YOUR HELP!!!

Review title: As good as the first two
Review_body: Great special fx, great acting, great action, cool twists of the plot to explain to all of us who are confused. And best ending anywhere.Downside? Yeah, there's one. No Linda Hamilton. She needed to be here with Nick Stahl. But otherwise, kicks @$$. Bring on T4 now, please.Comedy was a nice reprieve from the jaw-dropping action. So it was welcome there.Am pretty sure some of the $175 million was pocketed, though. No way in hell did all that money go for the film itself. Oh well. That's Hollywood, I guess.But either way, bring on T4 with or without Arnold. Though I think he will be in T4, considering he sucks as a state leader, as all Bush supporters are doomed to do.

I think the director of T3 just gave up doing one thing that other series movie director want to do. That is, "N+1 should be better than n". Yes, T2 is fantastic, outstanding, classic of all time, or simply-invincible. Trying to make more effects, explosions will not make any good, so why not ignore T2 and tell a whole new story for upcoming T4, T5? If you consider T3 as a introductory to the real judgement day, T3 has many clues and foreshadowing which can be developed for John Connor.But I still can not imagine how John lead the mankind to fight back. With some home-make bombs? And in T3, Skynet only has some prototype of T1 in 2003, that's a little bit too weak. Remember, T-800 are supposed to conquer the Earth in early 21st! Maybe John did see 2 terminators and know how they were terminated, but that's far far away from fighting back by a resistance leader who only know how to make dynamics!

Review title: I don't love it so much!!!
Review_body: I don't love Terminator 3 so much terminator 2 film is more powerful, nice, photograph, story and everything than Terminator 3 film.i wait this film 7 years, and when i saw it, oh my god. really Terminator 2 film is the best of Terminator films for our amazing actor Arnold. ===================================================================== I don't love Terminator 3 so much terminator 2 film is more powerful, nice, photograph, story and everything than Terminator 3 film.i wait this film 7 years, and when i saw it, oh my god. really Terminator 2 film is the best of Terminator films for our amazing actor Arnold.

I went to see this movie with open-arms and was rewarded with a wonderful action film (the best in the year) that totally lived up to the hype and my expectations.The CG is far superior to T1 and T2, and the acting never had any embarrassingly corny lines--like Terminator 1 (and the romance never did it for me in that film).The new Terminator (TX) is played rather well by Kristanna Loken, and the design of this cyborg is fantastic---a noted improvement from the T-1000, who I thought was a bit of a wimp.Of course, this movie belongs to Arnie, who commands the screen and has some very good scenes. As for Stahl and Danes, they are perfectly cast, and Stahl is a relief from someone who thought the Edward Furlong John Connor was pretty painful.Those two actors really do play second fiddle to the action here, which looks spectacular, and sadly (for some) does not leave as much room for character development as T1 and T2.However, if you're interest in the Terminator series is generally for the action and less about whether Terminators "really can love and learn the value of human life", then you will absolutely adore this movie, and without a doubt find it a welcome addition to the former 2.If, you are an aficionado of the series, you will be hard-pressed to find the human elements of the former two movies, although it goes without saying that there is a ton of information about the Machine uprising here that you would do well to take into account.I personally loved this film, and, while not yet considered the classic of T1 and T2, it is only a matter of time.

Review title: To the European with the flag problem
Review_body: The reason the American flag is there is because it is an American movie. You should also be happy that America makes movies because there's no types of movies like this made anywhere else from what I can see. Also a neutral country can not comment on this because you don't have the nuts to choose sides. We bailed Europe out of speaking German twice so thats why the flag flies. When Sweden starts making movies that cost more than 100 million dollars then you can fly your own flag and maybe just maybe you can stop bashing the American flag. Remember that flag that your hating gave up a lot of lives to protect people like you, so next time you see it just think for a second half a million of their people died so that my land could be free.

This is a dire movie, it's so bad I do not even consider there to be 3 Terminator movies. It has been made simply for the money (look at its certificate compared to the first two, its clearly aimed at the bigger target audience); it's been made for the sake of being made. It is an insult to the first two excellent movies. Personally I would of preferred it if they simply left it at two movies, this third instalment makes fun of a lot of the stuff that made the first two movies cool. It is more of a comedy than anything else and a bad one at that. Its rating certainly doesn't reflect this movies quality (or lack of); I think it gets a lot of votes from kids who know nothing about the original movies and just like it for its big budget special effects. Watch this movie once and then burn it.
